title: Sales Associate - 24H150
description:
Sales Associate - 24H150

**Employee Type:**


Temporary### **If you are a CURRENT Carter’s employee, you MUST apply through the Internal Career Link within the My Career & Performanceapp in . Do not apply using the below external application.**

**Carter’s, Inc. is the largest branded marketer in North America of apparel exclusively for babies and young children. The Company owns the Carter’s and OshKosh B’gosh brands, two of the most recognized brands in the marketplace. These brands are sold in leading department stores, national chains, and specialty retailers domestically and internationally. They are also sold through more than 1,000 Company-operated stores in the United States, Canada, and Mexico and online at www.carters.com, www.oshkosh.com, www.cartersoshkosh.ca, and www.carters.com.mx. The Company’s Child of Mine brand is available at Walmart, its Just One You brand is available at Target, and its Simple Joys brand is available on Amazon. The Company also owns Skip Hop, a global lifestyle brand for families with young children. Carter’s is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Additional information may be found at www.carters.com.**

**Baby Clothing, Kids Clothes, Toddler Clothes | Carter's**

**Shop for baby clothing, baby necessities and essentials at Carters.com, the most trusted name in baby, kids, and toddler clothing. Shop our selection of cute baby & kids clothing.**

**Love what you do. Carter’s Careers.**


As a Sales Associate, you will be the first face of the brand for growing families. You’ll congratulate new parents and grandparents, introduce them to our new baby essentials, help them prep for their first day of school, and all the big and little moments of their parenting journey. You’ll join a welcoming and inclusive environment that values and optimizes skills and talents.

**What we love about Carter’s:**


Carter’s Inc. is the largest North American apparel retailer exclusively for babies and young children, encompassing Carter’s, OshKosh B’gosh, Skip\\*Hop, and Little Planet brands. Carter’s is the #1 most-purchased children’s clothing brand.\\* We’ve become an industry leader by providing quality - from the first Original Bodysuit® to the lasting careers we offer our team. We’ve kept our close-knit culture since our founding, and we invest in our teams with training and development programs, so we all succeed together. A Carter’s career doesn’t feel like a job. It feels like connections, between customers, teams, and families. Caring, teamwork, flexibility, and growth are what make us different. What’s not to love?

**Benefits we love:**

* Schedules that fit your life. Our hours of operation allow you to balance work and personal activities - whether you have class, enjoy a morning workout, or manage carpool.
* Benefits and perks that make life better, including part-time health benefits, mental health benefits, a 30% discount on our brands, referral bonuses, and much more!
* Advance You Program helps earn a GED or a bachelor’s degree tuition-free or learn English as a second language!
* The opportunity to learn and build skills and grow as an individual. We provide professional and personal development to help shape your career.
* Development programs to help you grow in your current role and beyond. Whether you’re looking to join us for a season or a long-term career, you can grow at Carter’s.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Welcome customers with a warm greeting and provide assistance with our product styles, features, and benefits
* Confidently and proactively resolve issues for customers and balance a number of customers in a busy retail environment
* Meet customer needs by assisting with omnichannel as needed to ensure a positive shopping experience
* Execute and expedite point of sale/register transactions
* Complete floor replenishment and shipment as needed
* Articulate current promotional events and the brand loyalty program, including credit, to customers
* Minimize store loss by providing exceptional customer service and maintaining a safe, clean store

**Qualities we’d love in a candidate:**

* A positive and solutions-oriented mindset
* Demonstrated customer service and engagement skills
* Effective and professional verbal and written communication skills
* The ability to manage multiple tasks at once

**You can:**

* Lift 40 pounds as needed, with frequent bending, stooping, reaching, pushing, and pulling
* Stand or walk for extended periods of time; climb up and down a ladder
* Provide availability that may include days, nights, weekends, and holidays as scheduled

**Carter’s for all:**


Carter's is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. (Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran).


NOTE: This job description is not all-inclusive. The duties described may be changed or reassigned at the discretion of management, and the employee may be required to perform duties that are not listed in the job description. Carter’s may reasonably alter your duties, responsibilities, job title, and location.


Carters is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.
company_description: Carter’s,Inc. is the largest branded marketer in the US and Canada of apparel and related products exclusively for babies and young children.

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
**Job Description**

**Position: Direct Support Professional**

**Function:**

To establish a therapeutic milieu and deliver effective services through positive behavioral support and professionalism. To support individuals in maintaining their independence and empowering them to become integrated members of their communities.

**Responsibilities:** 

▪ Implements the behavior plan as developed by the behavioral specialist, if applicable; ▪ Supervises individuals with developmental disabilities to ensure safety

▪ Provides one-to-one personal care and supervision to the individual while in and out of the community (includes but is not limited to lifting, transferring, toileting, feeding, bathing and dressing)

▪ Transports and accompanies individuals on activities in the community in addition to medical appointments

▪ Documents daily behavior, special incidents, accidents and any other information that pertains to each individuals care

▪ Assists in the development and modification of individual habilitation plans (IHP); ▪ Assists and teaches appropriate nutrition, personal hygiene and life skill

▪ Completes all Department of Human Services (DHS) required trainings and continues to improve skills through the College of Direct Support, the Elizabeth M. Boggs Center and other trainings opportunities

▪ Is responsible for all documentation and administration of medication; ▪ Attends team meetings in addition to supervision; and ▪ Performs other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications/Requirements:** 

▪ Must be at least 18 years of age

▪ Minimum of a High School diploma with prior experience working the developmentally disabled and/or behaviorally challenged individuals

▪ Preferred: Bachelor’s degree with relevant experience

▪ Must be able to physical care for clients, which includes lifting, transferring, bending, sitting, and stooping. Must be able to lift and carry 50 Ibs.

▪ Valid state driver’s license and good driving history; ▪ Good writing and communication skills

▪ Ability to effectively work with people of diverse cultural backgrounds and races

▪ Ability to effectively work as a team member and implement positive behavioral supports

▪ Must cooperate with the licensee and the DHS staff in any inspection or investigation; ▪ Ability to effectively work as a member of a team

▪ Ability to work effectively with clients including intervention and relationship building skills

▪ Ability to effectively work as a team member and implement positive behavioral supports and person centered planning.

Note: Four Corners Community Services an equal opportunity employer that reserves the right to modify this job description as business operations require. Group Mentor may be relocated to other sites as needed. Due to the nature of this direct care position, only short term reasonable accommodations will be considered.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.00 - $17.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Hiring CHHA's in UNION, ESSEX, AND MORRIS COUNTY Apply now!
description:
***Executive Home Care is looking for great employees just like you!***  

  

*Executive Home Care is currently hiring dedicated, compassionate people who enjoy helping others. As a professional caregiver, you will provide direct care to seniors who need a little help with everyday living*.  

  

***Job description***  

  

***Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA) - Homecare / In Home***  

  

*Executive Care is looking to hire for immediate work in the Dover, Livingston, Montclair, Roseland, West Orange, Caldwell, Verona, Florham Park, Morris Plains, and Morristown area. We are excited to offer competitive pay, flexible work schedules, and a generous sign-on bonus!*  

  

*Rated as* ***Employer of Choice - 2022****, Executive Care is looking to expand our team and bring in those who want to make a difference by offering high quality in-home care for seniors.*  

  

*We value our employees and aim to provide benefits that help and encourage them to provide the best services possible.*  

  

***Job Benefits:***  

  

* ***OVERTIME and Holiday Pay!***
* ***FREE Health Insurance!***
* ***Refer-A-Friend bonuses and employee incentives!***
* ***Competitive salaries***
* ***Earned Sick Leave***
* ***Opportunities to continue education.***
* ***Positive work environment!***
* ***Flexible schedules***
* ***Direct Deposit***
* ***Mileage reimbursement***
* ***Paid orientation***
* ***Paid time off***
* ***Paid training***
* ***Safety equipment provided.***
* ***Tuition reimbursement***

***\\*Job Responsibilities:***  

  

* *Assist with personal care (dressing, mobility, bathing, grooming, toileting, exercise)*
* *Emotional support and companionship*
* *Medication reminders*
* *Accompany client to medical appointments, errands and social events*
* *Light housekeeping and laundry*
* *Meal preparation*

*\\*Responsibilities vary per client*  

  

***Job Schedule:***  

  

* *Hourly shifts can range from 4 hours to 12 hours*
* *Day shift, Midday shift, Evening shifts and Overnight shifts available*
* *Monday to Friday shifts available!*
* *Weekend shifts available!*
* *Full-time and part-time shifts available!*
* *Flexible days & hours!*

***Job Requirements:***  

  

* *Valid New Jersey Certified Home Health Aide License Required*
* *High school diploma or GED*
* *Recent negative TB test*
* *Proof of MMR vaccine (measles, mumps, rubella)*
* *Ability to stand, walk, squat, bend, kneel, reach, twist, push and pull. Varied assistance is required depending on the mobility of the client. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds*

***Experience***  

  

* *Caregiving: 1 year (preferred)*


***An Equal Opportunity Employer***  

  

*Executive Home Care is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state, or local laws.*  

  

*Job Types: Full-time, Part-time*  

  

*Salary: $18.00 - $22.00 per hour*  

  

***Employee Referral Program***  

  

*We will* be *offering a referral bonus for any employee that you refer to our office. This is a great way to earn some extra cash!*  

  

*RULES OF THE PROGRAM*  

  

* *Please make sure the person who you refer mentions your first and last name at the interview, so we know who gets credit for the referral!*
* *The employee must be an active certified home health aide (CHHA) in New Jersey and in good standing with the board of nursing.*
* *Employees must work 60 days- after the 60 days is completed you will be paid the bonus amount in your paycheck.*

  

*How the program will pay out*  

  

* *Refer 1 employee= $200.00 per employee*
* *Refer 2 employees= $250.0o per employee*
* *Refer 3 employees= $300.00 per employee*
* *Refer 4 employees= $350.00 per employee*
* *Refer 5 employees= $400.00 per employee*

  

*Medical specialties:*  

  

* *Geriatrics*
* *Home Health*
* *Hospice & Palliative Medicine*

*Standard shift:*  

  

* *Day shift*
* *Night shift*

*Supplemental schedule:*  

  

* *Holidays*
* *On call*
* *Overtime*

*Work setting:*  

  

* *Hospital*
* *Inpatient*
* *In-person*
* *Live-in*
* *Long term care*
* *Nursing home*
* *Outpatient*
* *Rehabilitation center*

*Education:*  

  

* *High school or equivalent (Required)*


*Experience:*  

  

* *Healthcare: 1 year (Preferred)*


*Language:*  

  

* *English (Required)*


*License/Certification:*  

  

* *Certified Home Health Aide (Required)*


*Work Location:* *One location*  

  

  

  

*MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN A SENIOR’S LIFE!*  

  

*Please call Amanda to schedule an interview!*  

*848-480-1001*

title: Cocktail Bartender
description:
\\*\\*Job Title:\\*\\* Cocktail Bartender

\\*\\*Location:\\*\\* Mesón – Upscale Spanish Cocktail Bar & Restaurant

\\*\\*Position Overview:\\*\\*

Mesón, a vibrant and upscale Spanish cocktail bar and restaurant, is seeking a talented and experienced Cocktail Bartender to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and has a passion for mixology, delivering exceptional guest experiences, and working with authentic Spanish ingredients and techniques.

\\*\\*Key Responsibilities:\\*\\*

- Craft and serve a wide variety of signature cocktails, with a focus on Spanish-inspired drinks and modern classics.

- Maintain extensive knowledge of cocktail recipes, spirits, wine, and beer, especially with Spanish offerings.

- Deliver an exceptional guest experience by providing friendly and attentive service.

- Collaborate with bar staff and management to create new drink menus, specials, and pairings.

- Manage multiple orders efficiently and maintain composure during peak hours.

- Maintain a clean, organized, and well-stocked bar area, following health and safety regulations.

- Provide recommendations based on guest preferences and answer any questions about ingredients, preparation, and pairings.

- Stay current on industry trends and continuously seek to improve knowledge and skills.

\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*

- Minimum of 2 years of bartending experience in a high-volume, fast-paced bar or restaurant setting.

- Strong knowledge of mixology, with a creative flair for crafting cocktails.

- Experience with Spanish ingredients, liquors, and traditional cocktails is highly preferred.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to multitask, work under pressure, and remain calm and professional during busy shifts.

- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Must have or be willing to obtain food handler and alcohol safety certifications.

- Availability to work nights, weekends, and holidays.

\\*\\*What We Offer:\\*\\*

- Competitive pay and tips.

- Opportunity to work in a dynamic, upscale environment with a passionate and professional team.

- Growth and development opportunities within the restaurant and bar industry.

- Staff discounts on food and beverages.

Join us at Mesón and bring your mixology expertise to life in an authentic, high-energy setting!

To apply, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your experience and passion for the craft of cocktail bartending.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $15.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Experience:

* Spirits experience: 1 year (Required)
* Wine knowledge: 1 year (Required)
* Bartending: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11231 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Operator/Server
description:
Who Doesn’t Love FREE ICE CREAM?!

Get a breath of fresh air, sweet treats, and deliver happiness as one of our premier team members at this exciting and emerging start-up company!

Scream Truck's ideal Operator is an upbeat leader who is tech-savvy, hard-working, and hospitality-minded. The Operator's primary responsibility is safely driving and navigating our Scream Trucks through various neighborhood markets by following our revolutionary optimized-routing software. NO CDL REQUIRED and WE TRAIN YOU! (Don’t feel comfy driving? Don’t worry, STILL APPLY! )

Upon arriving at each reserved stop or private event, the Operator works alongside a Co-Operator to efficiently prepare FRESH, INSTAGRAM-WORTHY soft-serve treats while ensuring a friendly and personalized customer experience.

With a lively personality and POSITIVE attitude, the team simultaneously handles pre-paid mobile orders and walk-up customer requests, while managing time to ensure efficient arrival to the next destination (generally homes within and around the block).

From safely (and timely) driving our vehicles to preparing/serving delicious scream, Operators are the core leaders on the truck!

What’s in it for me you ask…?!

PERKS FOR YOU (just to name a few)!

WEEKLY PAY (When that Direct Deposit hits)

Work OUTDOORS (not stuck behind a desk)

Upbeat and FRIENDLY Staff (find your new BFF)

KICKSTART YOUR CAREER (we promote from within!)

FREE SCREAM (sample/take home treats whenever you work)

This role is hands-on, fast-paced, and FUN! Get in on the ground floor of a cool company with other awesome people where your role can grow over time. Scream Truck planted its roots in New Jersey, but will scale across other national markets over time. Our communities are hyped and the demand is high, so, are you ready?!

**Required Qualifications:**

* Pristine driving record and ability to safely drive a very large vehicle (think U-HAUL truck, training will be provided). Relevant for Operator/Driver only.
* Ability to efficiently navigate local neighborhoods using a map and GPS
* Exceptional people and communication skills
* Upbeat, friendly, and outgoing personality, eager to serve customers happily
* Strong work ethic with a “CAN-DO” attitude

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Background in the food service industry
* Background in driving a truck or large vehicles
* Skilled in public speaking
* Strong Customer service skills

**Physical Requirements**

* Ability to alternate between sitting and standing frequently during shift
* Ability to travel through a cabin of approximately 2.5 feet wide efficiently
* Controlled fine motor skills to prepare fresh, made to order treats
* Ability to reach above head for items on shelves
* Ability to occasionally lift up to 25lbs

**About Scream Truck:**

Scream Truck is the first experiential, personalized ice cream delivery service in the world! Our unique custom-built trucks combined with our proprietary customer service software creates a completely frictionless on-demand experience that revolutionizes the ice cream and food truck business model. Customers sign up to receive text alerts whenever Scream Truck is servicing their neighborhood, they simply reply Y to request a stop. Scream Truck delivers premium “soft scream” treats (sundaes, cones & shakes) made fresh to order outside the customer's home.

We’ve serve a large number of communities in Northern and Central NJ. If we, haven’t been to your house yet, we’re sure to see you soon! To sign up, visit our website at www.screamtruck.com.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to safely drive a very large vehicle (think UPS truck)?
* I consent to Scream Truck sending me text messages regarding my application for this job

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: Dental Assistant, RDA, RDH, Foreign Trained Dentist
description:
#### **Dental Assistant**



Are you passionate about making people smile? Join Diamond Braces as a **Dental Assistant!** Enjoy growth opportunities, great benefits, and a supportive team that's all about creating world-class smiles. Ready to make smiles your business? We’d love to meet you!


#### **Why Diamond Braces?**



At Diamond Braces, your career growth is our priority. We provide continuous opportunities to learn, advance, and take on new challenges. As part of our team, you’ll have a clear path to success, with the support and resources you need to reach your professional goals while making a meaningful impact on our clients’ lives.


#### **What We Offer:**


* Competitive salary based on licensure and experience
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance packages
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* 401(k) with company match
* Discounted orthodontic care for you and your family
* Loan assistance for dental assistant school and continuing education (CE)
* Ample growth & advancement opportunities
* Convenient office locations

#### **Essential Functions:**


* **Assist with Dental and Ortho Procedures:** Provide chairside assistance during dental treatments, ensuring the dentist has the necessary tools and support to deliver quality care.
* **Prepare Treatment Rooms:** Set up and sterilize instruments and equipment, ensuring a clean and safe environment for all dental procedures.
* **Take Dental X-rays: Capture** high-quality dental images as needed, following safety protocols to protect patients and staff.
* **Educate Clients on Oral Health:** Help clients understand the importance of maintaining good oral hygiene and provide instructions on post-treatment care.
* **Manage Dental Records:** Accurately maintain and update patient records, ensuring all information is correctly documented.
* **Ensure Infection Control:** Follow strict sterilization and disinfection procedures to prevent cross-contamination and protect patient health.
* **Support the Dental Team:** Assist with various tasks as needed to ensure the smooth operation of the practice.
* **Maintain a Clean Workspace:** Keep your work area clean and organized, upholding the highest standards of safety and hygiene.
* **Stay Flexible:** Be ready to handle additional tasks as required, adapting to the changing needs of the practice.

#### **Preferred Qualifications:**


* Relevant dental assistant licensure (if required by state law).
* Experience in a dental or healthcare setting.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in dental software and technology.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
* Commitment to continuous learning and professional development.

#### **Who We Are:**



At Diamond Braces, we believe in improving lives through healthier smiles. Our mission is to provide orthodontic care that is affordable, accessible, and delivered with amazing customer service . We’re committed to making every smile count, and we live by our **“No Smile Left Behind”** philosophy.


#### **Additional Information:**


* This position is full-time, and local travel between offices may be required.
* Salary is based on licensure, experience, skills, and qualifications.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and help our clients achieve the smile of their dreams, **apply today!**

#### **Licenses & Certifications**


Preferred* CPR Certificate
* RDA License

title: Foreman Iron Worker
description:
**Job Summary**  

  

We are searching for an experienced and reliable foreman ironworker to run structural steel erection projects in New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Delaware.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

* Knowledgeable in layout, rigging, connecting, bolting and welding steel by following prints and instructions while guaranteeing all quality and safety standards are met.
* Read and follow blueprints, sketches and other instructions.
* Efficiently coordinate and manage all aspects of steel erection projects from start to finish
* Track project progress and report to office regularly
* Prep tools and equipment prior to jobs starting

  

  

  

**Qualifications**  

* High school diploma or its equivalent
* Must be able to lift 70lbs and withstand the physical demands of erecting steel

title: Summer Day Camp Nurse
description:
**CAMP OVERVIEW**

Willow Lake Day Camp is located in New Jersey on 35 shady acres across from the north shore of Lake Hopatcong. Our campers range in age from Pre-K through 10th grade. We operate Monday through Friday 8:30 am – 4:00 pm from June 23rd through August 15th 2025. We offer Aquatics, Athletics, Arts and Adventure activities plus lots of exciting special events throughout the summer!

*Come be a part of the magic of summer camp!*

**Job Summary & Responsibilities**

Nurses are a vital part of the Willow Lake Day Camp experience as health and safety are our top priorities every summer. Our nurses are warm, caring, empathetic and patient. They communicate internally with our office staff and externally with camper's families. They are comforting and offer guidance for our families and staff. The experience at Willow Lake is very relatable to school nurse responsibilities and as such, school nurses are strongly encouraged to apply!

Apply in minutes on OUR WEBSITE at willowlakedaycamp.com through the "Work At Camp" section.

**Summer 2025 Dates**

* June 23rd - August 15th, 2025
* Closed on July 4

**Benefits and Perks**

* Lunch provided daily

title: Associate Scientist
description:
Job Description
At Azenta, new ideas, new technologies and new ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer-focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and challenge the status quo with novel thinking and collaborative work relationships.


Azenta Life Sciences is a global leader in the life sciences space with headquarters in Burlington, MA, and offices and operations worldwide. We are a market leader in automated bio sample management solutions and genomic services across areas such as drug development, clinical and advanced cell therapies for the industry's top pharmaceutical, biotech, academic and healthcare institutions globally. We provide unparalleled capabilities with our lab analysis, sample management and storage services, informatics software, and consumables, with the largest installed base managing over 1 billion samples globally.

**How You’ll Make an Impact**  

  

Be an integral part of an exciting, fast-growing team where you can leverage your outstanding bench skills in our regulated Sanger laboratory! With your molecular background, you will be able to utilize not only your existing skills, but will also learn many new techniques, creating attractive new growth opportunities.

**What You’ll Do**

* Perform nucleic acid extractions and prepare PCR amplicons for high-throughput sequencing
* Carry out DNA sequencing on Sanger DNA analyzers
* Perform routine maintenance of lab equipment and DNA analyzers
* Check inventory and replenish consumable sequencing supplies
* Communicate with vendors by phone and e-mail in a friendly and professional manner
* Sample quality and quantity check using various methods and equipment

**What You Will Bring**

* BS in Biological Sciences or equivalent required.
* Some laboratory benchwork experience required
* Understanding of Molecular Biology principles and technologies
* Experience in a Sanger Sequencing lab preferred.
* Comfortability working in a Biosafety Level 2 laboratory.
* Ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a fast-paced customer oriented environment.
* Highly motivated and well organized.
* Independent, detailed oriented, team player.
* Closely follow Standard Operating Protocols (SOPs).
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to react to situations with a sense of urgency.
* Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Excellent documentation and record keeping skills

**EOE M/F/Disabled/VET**

title: Principal Research Scientist - Data
description:
**Company Description**  

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for a Principal Data Scientist to lead a team that will analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve the data to insights journey for our US Organization. We will rely on your team to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We want to see a passion for machine-learning, research, and developing a team of talented data scientists. Your goal will be to help our enterprise service organizations analyze trends to make better decisions across a portfolio of model assets.

**What you’ll be doing:**


The Principal Data Scientist of Enterprise Services will be responsible for designing, executing, and socializing analytical solutions to challenges across Abbvie’s enterprise services organizations both as a manager as well as a “hand’s on” contributor. You will apply statistics, machine learning, and operations research techniques to enhance efforts in driving efficiencies, identifying cost savings, and developing products. You will work closely with IT and business stakeholders to develop analytical tools and foster the practice of data science. A candidate for this position should not only be skillful in quantitative methodologies and programming, but also have keen business acumen. Experience with reanalyzing previously existing data sets and tables in order to repurpose them for new use cases. Ability to work in a diverse team and the willingness to learn are key to this role.

**Core Job Responsibilities:**

* Lead a team of 1-3 data scientists dedicated to enterprise services, including recruitment, onboarding, training, and development.
* Work with stakeholders to define business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives, and success criteria.
* Develop and implement methods for extracting patterns and correlations from both internal and external data sources using machine learning toolkits.
* Construct and develop predictive models that are reliable, scalable, and modular.
* Maintain and optimize existing machine learning models.
* Develop plan to put machine learning models into production.
* Adopt new tools/techniques to increase performance, automation, and scalability.
* Report, visualize and communicate results to internal stakeholders on a regular basis.
* Actively participate and establish a “test and learn” team environment with a clear prioritized plan that is designed to create a bias for action (fail fast/often).
* Examine relevant data and quickly develop an analytics plan that will answer key business questions and create value for clients.
* Work with data sets of varying degrees of size and complexity, including both structured and unstructured data.
* Transform data into actionable insights and recommendations. Present clear and concise results. This includes processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.
* Develop analytical solutions by using and applying appropriate methodology – including, but not limited to, regression, forecasting, clustering, decision trees, simulation, optimization, machine learning, and neural networks.
* Design and define approach to scale and operationalize models for machine learning.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Masters’ degree required in quantitative fields such as Statistics, Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science or Economics. PhD is a plus.
* 8+ years’ progressive business experiences in marketing analytics, database marketing, data engineering and predictive modeling or strong academic background.
* Ability to develop advanced machine learning models using scikit-learn, Keras, or other machine learning frameworks.
* Strong algorithmic design skills. Execute analytical experiments methodically while outputting reproducible research.
* Demonstrated proficiency in Python, R, SQL, Relational databases (Teradata, Oracle etc.), BI tools (Power BI, Qlik Sense) and IDEs like Jupyter, with experience in leveraging available packages and libraries to accelerate time to market.
* Experience with big data technologies like Hive, Impala, Hue etc.
* Experience in Pharmaceutical datasets like patient claims and syndicated data from IQVIA (IMS) and Symphony Health Solutions a big plus.
* Strong problem solving and interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a diverse team including IT and Line of business analytics teams.
* Bring a strong entrepreneurial spirit and ability to think dynamically.
* Strong communication skills, written and verbal.
* Project management experience; solid attention to detail and operational focus.

  

**Additional Information**  

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:


* The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.
* We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
* This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs.
* This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.  



AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Job Coach
description:
***YAI supports people of all ages with intellectual and developmental disabilities in achieving the fullest lives possible by creating new opportunities for living, loving, working and learning.***

**If you want a career supporting others, creatively finding solutions to life's challenges, and building a more inclusive community, YAI is the place for you.**

**Benefits of working with YAI:**

* **DailyPay** - ***Work today, get paid today!***
* Medical/Dental coverage for some part-time and all full-time positions
* Tuition reimbursement
* Paid Vacation/Holidays and Sick Time
* 403(b) retirement with employer matching contribution
* Life Insurance
* Discounts on travel, entertainment, wireless services, shopping, and more!

**About the position:**

We are hiring an **Employment Training Specialist** (**Job Coach**) to support people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD) establish and pursue their employment goals in **New York City**.

ETSs provide job coaching, on-the-job and vocational training and assist in the improvement of communication and socialization skills through regular visits or direct supervision of the people we support at their workplaces across assigned region(s), virtual and one-on-one meetings.

**Key/Essential Functions & Responsibilities:**

* Supports people with I/DD to realize, set and meet their employment goals, assisting them in overcoming their personal barriers and engages in respectful communications/conversations through person-first language to help them understand their goals and ambitions.
* Works with unemployed individuals, providing pre-employment counseling to explore career interests and support job development activities and facilitating training groups where professional skills and behaviors are taught and developed to assist people we support in obtaining and maintaining employment in the community.
* Directly supervises and provides on-site job and job skills training, coaching and support at job sites for people we support and in accordance with each person’s employment goals, utilizing support skills for people with moderate to complex levels of need.
* Regularly travels across assigned region to visit employed individuals at their workplaces, speaking with managers to obtain feedback on performance and addressing any issues or concerns that may arise; escalates issues and concerns to an administrator for support, as needed.
* Reviews and completes all other required paperwork and documentation to ensure compliance and/or billing, as applicable, completely and accurately and within appropriate timeframes (e.g., notifications, logging, incident reports, update files, maintenance requests, phone calls, progress notes and services).
* Complies with all Federal, State, Local and other relevant regulatory agency requirements, including the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).
* May perform direct support professional tasks, including providing personal care and assisting in activities of daily living (ADLs) in other settings outside of employment if appropriately trained and authorized, as directed and/or outside of employment schedule (e.g. residential, day services, community habilitation, etc.).
* Performs all other duties as assigned.

**Education, Experience, and Requirements:**

* High School Diploma or GED; **or** 1-2 years work experience providing vocational and/or pre-vocational services to individuals with disabilities.
* Completes necessary trainings, including OPWDD approved vocational rehabilitation or supported employment training program and annual retraining(s) where applicable.
* Ability to meet essential physical demands of position, including frequent walking, sitting, standing, bending, twisting, stooping, kneeling, crouching, pushing, pulling and reaching with hands and arms; use hands to handle, finger or feel objects, tools or controls; lifting and/or moving up to 25 pounds on occasion; having the physical capacity to assist people we support in performing the functions of their jobs.
* Tuberculosis test mandatory for most positions.

Schedule:

* Full-time positions available in **Brooklyn**, **Bronx**, and **Manhattan**.
* Hours may vary as required by caseload, ***including*** occasional evening and/or weekend hours and regular travel throughout assigned region(s).

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
**Who we are**

We are a medical testing facility that specializes in comprehensive cardiovascular and pulmonary medical evaluations for first responders throughout New Jersey. Our practice was built out of the Captain Buscio Program, a foundation created by Donna Buscio after her husband, Captain Dominick Buscio of the Jersey City Fire Department, unexpectedly passed away at 39 from a heart attack.

Our cardiovascular and pulmonary tests help current and retired members of the police force, state troopers, firefighters, and EMTs to be aware of their cardiovascular health and help to identify any health concerns. Employers do not mandate our tests, and the results do not affect our patients' employment. Currently, we have six different locations across New Jersey and have hopes to open more soon.

**What we do**

We administer tests to evaluate heart and lung functionality. We offer seven different tests for our patients over a five-hour appointment time slot. Our patients are able to come back two weeks after their appointment to review their results with our team of board-certified medical professionals.

**What we are looking for**

Currently, we are in the process of recruiting a full-time front desk receptionist. You will be responsible for scheduling appointments, completing patient intakes, and updating patient records. You will be the face of the medical office and the first person our patients see when they walk into the office. As an employee will have access to medical, vision, and dental insurance as well as PTO.

Responsibilities:

* Schedule patient testing and follow-up appointments.
* Scan patient's personal information and insurance for medical records.
* Complete patient intake documents prior to an appointment to evaluate eligibility for services.
* Administer covid screener and record the temperature of all patients who enter the office.
* Submitting and managing patient information in electronic medical records.
* Create hard-copy patient packets for doctors and medical staff for upcoming appointments.
* Answering all patient inquiries in person, over the phone, and through email.
* Additional administrative tasks as needed.

Required:

* A High School Degree or equivalent
* Experience communicating with Insurance companies
* Background in the Medical field
* Attention to detail
* Multitasking skills
* 45-50 wpm typing score

* Microsoft and google office suite: 1 year (Preferred)
* Data entry/medical billing: 1 year (Preferred)
* Experience with NaviNet (Preferred)
* Clerk experience
* Spanish Speaking is a plus
* Medical records experience plus

title: Community Health Worker
description:
**Job Summary:**

Under the direction of the Program Administrator or Designee, the Community Health Worker is responsible for conducting community outreach activities and community collaboration to engage and refer community residents. Outreach staff will distribute information about MVNHC throughout the local neighborhoods, at events hosted by local municipal agencies, community-based organizations. Community Outreach workers will have extensive knowledge of community resources for vulnerable community residents.

**Primary Responsibility of the Position:**

* Develops and maintains professional relationships with community and community leaders, i.e., churches, community action programs, etc. to assist in gaining health center acceptance by the community
* Presents programs and/or educational forums about the health center’s goals and objectives
* Exhibits strong interpersonal, communication and problem-solving skills
* Performs home visits to ensure that all information regarding related health services is communicated to ensure positive health outcomes
* Informs residents and potential patients about the availability of MVNHC services.
* Interprets MVNHC services in conjunction with identifying current and potential patient’s needs for services.
* Establishes community to ensure that patients are aware of and have access to all suitable programs and services available at MVNHC.
* Performs related outreach tasks as assigned.
* Assists and streamlines the registration process of identified outreach individuals.
* Follow-up with registered MVNHC individuals regarding services rendered.
* Calls registered MVNHC individuals as a reminder for follow-up or referral appointments.
* Provides and collects “Satisfaction Survey” of services rendered.
* Participates in special community events providing information that promotes the services of MVNHC.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Education and Experience:**

* Graduation from a standard high school or general equivalent diploma
* One (1) year prior experience related to the duties and responsibilities specified, or five (5) years of professional experience providing outreach services in a health care setting or equivalent combination of education and experience that provided the required skills, knowledge, and abilities.
* Demonstrated reading and comprehension ability necessary to understand materials.
* Ability to serve as liaison to community organizations as assigned. Has acquired full understanding of ethical issues related to patients’ rights and HIPAA Laws.
* Must possess knowledge of community support services, basic requirements of community outreach duties, have acquired knowledge of the scope and activities of public and private health and community organizations.
* Must possess working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office (Windows, Word, Excel) email, internet research.
* Has the ability to communicate with patients, staff and associates effectively.
* Exhibits good judgement, tact, courtesy, integrity and is in physical condition commensurate with carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position.

EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

title: Ophthalmic Assistant
description:
**Position Summary**



The ophthalmic assistant conduct measurements and tests that provides the physician with the information needed to arrive at a diagnosis and to prescribe treatment. The ophthalmic assistant is responsible for required documentation in compliance with the policies and provide excellent patient services.


**Roles and Responsibilities**


* Takes an ocular and systemic history and accurately records visual acuity.
* Reviews patient chart to ensure completeness and accuracy of information.
* Performs testing required by type of exam scheduled, patient complaint and history.
* Acts as scribe while physician examines patient entering data into electronic medical records.
* Performs lensometry, automated refractometry, slit lamp examination including applanation tonometry, anterior chamber angle assessment and gross external exam in addition to ocular muscle motility and balance testing, assess pupils and confrontation visual fields.
* Administers diagnostic tests including but not limited to oct, automated visual fields, photography, pachymetry, biometry.
* Administers topical ophthalmic or oral medications.
* Assists with in-office procedures ensuring proper informed consent is obtained, sets up and cleans up after clinical procedures.
* Assists with patient education.
* Maintains cleanliness and orderliness of exam rooms during the workday.
* Complies with all practice procedures and protocols. Complies with all state and federal regulations. Understands and accepts responsibility to report potential or suspected errors to supervisor or compliance officer.
* Maintains positive attitude consisting of cooperation, self-motivation, courtesy, and professionalism.


**Knowledge, skills, abilities**


* Accountability – ability to accept responsibility and account for his/her actions or work performed. Willing to accept constructive criticism.
* Accuracy – ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly with attention to all details of a project or task.
* Adaptability – ability to adapt to and facilitate change in the workplace.
* Communication – ability to communicate effectively with others using good listening skills.
* Empathetic – ability to appreciate and be sensitive to the feelings of patients and co-workers. Exhibits a cheerful demeanor with the ability to display good-natured tolerance of delay or adversity.
* Initiative – ability to make decisions or take actions to solve a problem or reach a goal. Desire to excel, attempting non-routine tasks.
* Judgment – the ability to formulate a sound decision using the available information.
* Reliability – can be relied upon to demonstrate reliability in attendance and punctuality.
* Team player – the ability to work with others and independently for a common goal. Puts aside own individual needs to work toward the larger group objective and reinforces the contribution of others.


**Qualifications:**



High School diploma or equivalent required.



Previous experience in eye care preferred but not required.



Basic computer skills for electronic recordkeeping.



Strong interpersonal and communication skills.


**Physical Requirements & ADA Compliance:**



Ability to stand or sit for prolonged periods.



Visual acuity to perform job-related tasks.



Manual dexterity to operate specialized equipment.


**ADA Requirements:**



This job is compliant with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and we encourage people with disabilities to apply. Reasonable accommodation will be provided to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

title: Remodeling Sales Specialist
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Training & development

  

Kitchen Tune-Up is growing at an exciting pace! We are seeking dedicated team members to join our team with the mission of completing extraordinary kitchen remodeling projects. We are seeking career minded professionals who are willing to learn new techniques and are looking for a stable, well-paying career.  

  

Ideal candidates strongly believe in the company culture that our clients always come first. Our sales team members are coachable, have drive and empathy, have courage to try new things, are lifelong learners, and have a willingness to follow a process and be adaptable.  

Are you a leader? Do you have goals to grow within a company? Are you a big idea and big picture type of person? If yes, we encourage you to apply.  

  

Kitchen Tune-Up is a locally owned and operated business backed by a national franchise system with over 30 years as a leader in the remodeling industry. Our mission is to build trust with every client and elevate the remodeling experience into a timely and enjoyable process.  

  

**Benefits/Perks:**  

* Paid Training
* Competitive Compensation
* Bonus Opportunities
* Steady work
* Growth Opportunities

 **Duties and Responsibilities:**
  

* Manage lead flow and client projects from beginning to end.
* Maintain frequent communications with clients and prompt follow-up with prospects and clients.
* Conduct the Kitchen Tune-Up sales process (training is provided).
* Have confidence to ask for the sale, be persistent in follow-up, and have a strong desire to succeed.
* Track and maintain notes in our CRM software.
* Represent the brand professionally in appearance and attire, and position yourself as an industry professional.
* Communicate regularly with the franchise owner and sales manager and follow instructions for the sales process.
* **Generate leads at home shows and other networking, industry, and local events.**

**Qualifications**  

* High attention to detail
* Computer and smartphone proficient
* Highly motivated and dependable with a strong work ethic
* Optimistic and enthusiastic with a friendly personality.
* Ability to set priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.
* Professional appearance and demeanor suitable to working in clients’ homes.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Must have proven sales experience with background in remodeling.

Do you take pride in your work and want to be part of a growing local company that values your skills? This is a year-round position with paid training and bonus potential.  

  

**Why join the Kitchen Tune-Up team?**  

  

* Steady work and rapid growth in the market
* Company vehicle and fuel provided.
* Sales training and all sales tools and materials provided.
* Ongoing coaching and training provided.

We offer substantial training and lucrative compensation for those willing to work inside of a process, keep a sharp eye for detail, remodel the expectations of our clients, and work hard. Kitchen Tune-Up is a high-quality company, and we offer steady work and performance pay. Ongoing training with growth opportunities, if desired.  

Flexible work from home options available.


The positions on this website, unless otherwise indicated, are posted by Kitchen Tune-Up® franchisees. Kitchen Tune-Up® franchises are independently owned and operated businesses and if you accept a position with an Kitchen Tune-Up® franchisee, you are employed by that franchisee, and not by franchisor HFC KTU LLC, nor any of its parents or affiliates. The hiring franchisee is solely responsible for all employment decisions including hiring, termination, discipline, compensation and benefits and HFC KTU LLC and its parents and affiliates have no input or involvement in such matters. HFC KTU LLC does not receive, review or store any applications for employment. Any questions about posted positions or the hiring process must be directed to the Kitchen Tune-Up® franchisee posting the position.

title: Food Production Supervisor
description:
We have an incredible opportunity for a dynamic **Food Production Supervisor** to join our growing New York Team!

**Who We Are:**

We have a passion for hospitality culinary delights on every banquet floor and in the sky. With the three business segments of Airline Catering, International Event Catering, and Restaurants, Lounges & Hotels, DO & CO offers gourmet entertainment all over the world. We operate in 32 locations, 12 countries and 3 continents, maintaining the highest standard of quality in both our products and services. We refine the classics, develop the unknown and grow constantly, sometimes beyond our own expectations.

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversee the daily activities of the food production department, ensuring tasks are completed accurately and on time.
* Lead and manage a team of helpers, junior supervisors, and supervisors, fostering a productive and cohesive work environment.
* Ensure all meals are prepared and packed according to stringent deadlines and in compliance with food safety and hygiene standards.
* Partner with Food Production Manager to identify and execute planning for training and staffing needs
* Facilitate the training of new team members, monitor their performance, and provide ongoing support to help them achieve their goals.
* Identify and address problematic areas, proposing alternative solutions to enhance productivity and efficiency.
* Maintain adherence to all company guidelines, including HACCP, FDA regulations, and personal protective equipment (PPE) protocols.
* Coordinate the receipt, storage, and organization of supplies, closely monitoring inventory levels to ensure adequate stock.
* Collaborate with other departments and communicate effectively with management and team members to ensure the seamless completion of all tasks.
* Promptly report any departmental issues, such as production, inventory, or team-related matters, and ensure all documentation is accurate and up-to-date.
* Ensure quality assurance and economic efficiency to meet high-end food standards, including attending food tasting sessions and implementing feedback.
* Perform additional duties and responsibilities as assigned by management, upholding DO & CO standards.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 2 year of supervisory experience in a high-volume food service or food manufacturing production.
* Bilingual Spanish required.
* Demonstrates outstanding organizational skills and a knack for prioritizing tasks effectively.
* Capable of seamlessly managing multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced environment, dealing with a substantial workload, and sustaining periods of extended standing as required.
* Proficient culinary knowledge of terms, procedures, and practices.
* Adopts a hands-on approach and exhibits the ability to respond promptly with a sense of urgency.
* Displays flexibility in scheduling, accommodating different shifts (different shifts –days, nights, weekends, holidays).
* Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) and general food safety standards knowledge is required.
* Excellent in computer operations, including Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and other relevant applications.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to interact and work well within a diverse group with experience/exposure to leadership roles.
* Possesses at least a high school diploma, GED, or equivalent qualification, a Bachelor's degree is preferred.

**What We Offer:**

* **Estimated salary range: $62,500 - $70,000 annually.**
* Salaried employees are eligible for 401K, Commuter Benefits, and Healthcare Benefits such as Medical, Dental, & Vision.
* Daily Complimentary Meals (Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner).
* An organization dedicated to fostering innovation; in pursuit of cultivating creativity, embracing new ideas and leveraging our impeccable standard for hospitality.
* Genuine career development opportunities, both nationally and internationally.
* The chance to collaborate and represent a leading force in the luxury global gourmet entertainment industry.

**Diversity & Inclusion Statement:**

We want everyone to feel welcome, respected and we are committed to providing the best space, experience, and workplace for our teams - no matter what race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and make you. That is what makes our team so special.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

* 401(k) 3% Match
* Dental insurance

* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

* Weekends as needed

title: Commissioned Salesperson
description:
Keep our communities fed.

Our focus is simple but meaningful, from our distribution centers to our offices — every employee of C&S and their family of companies works to help feed local families, neighbors, and communities.

As a Salesperson with Davidson Specialty Foods, you will be responsible for sales, ordering merchandise, and building customer relationships with Stop & Shop. You will also be responsible for stocking the merchandise sold and should be an early self-starter who can organize and prioritize to complete their daily functions. Working with minimal supervision, you will develop customer relationships to provide exceptional service.

title: Bartender
description:
The journey of HAND Hospitality began with the making of hotspot Korean gastropub, Take31, on East 31st street. Since 2011, HAND has played an active role in expanding Korean and Japanese cuisines in Midtown, New York. The diversity within the group gives tremendous insight to varied Asian cultures, which helps create the basis of each project. It allows us to expand and share our community with others.

We are always looking to add self driven talent, with the right attitude to join our hospitality team. With those traits, we are confident we can help you reach your full potential. For HAND, it’s not just about seeking “high quality" staff—It’s about sharing our ideas, our concepts, our thinking and emotionally connecting with each other. We are excited to grab your hand and grow together.

Nestled in New York’s East Village, ARIARI is a Korean restaurant inspired by the port city of Busan, known for its fresh seafood and comforting Korean dishes. ARIARI is a native Korean word that means 'Pave your own way.' We’re proud to be paving our own track, introducing our unique interpretation of Korean gastronomy to New York. We hope to delight those new to the culture and spark feelings of nostalgic joy for those who are familiar. Enjoy the essence of Busan at ARIARI!

We are currently seeking a Bartender to join ARIARI. We are looking for an individual with the following:

-Proficiency In Steps of Service  
-Knowledgeable On Wines, Spirits, Classic Cocktails  
-Positive Attitude At All Times  
-Punctualuality Is Key

-Professionalism Is A Must  
-Prior Bartending Experience  
-Must Be Able To Work Minimum 3 Days A Week  
-Must Be Eligible To Work In The United States  
-Knowledge Of Korean Food And Culture Is A Plus

title: Team Lead, Commercial Effectiveness Sizing, Structuring, and Targeting
description:
ROLE SUMMARY
Pfizer is seeking an analytical leader for our Primary Care Commercial Effectiveness (PC CE) Portfolio Sizing, Structure, and Targeting Team. PC CE is a critical team within the Insight Strategy & Execution (ISE) group, focused on the driving performance of brand and sales teams through strategy and orchestration of the analytics teams within Commercial Analytics & AI (CAAI). This Lead will provide sales force sizing, structuring, targeting (SST) strategy, analytics, while consistent spearheading consistent customer engagement metrics across TAs. The Lead will work closely with senior sales leaders, providing them with valuable SST analyses to improve customer engagement and drive business growth. The leader of this team also will have responsibility for collaborating with the PC CE Team Lead, CEP Hybrid Sales and Account Leadership, and leadership of Pfizer Connect; Pfizer’s best-in-class virtual customer engagement team. Through this analytical support, the Lead and team will identify and enable Pfizer Connect to pursue the best opportunities to meet performance targets.
As part of the work to drive strategic field force planning, including determining the size, structure, and targets for the sales team, the Lead and team will work closely with the Field Force Analytics COE, Data Science, ISE partners, xSales Operations & Enablement, and Analytics Project Management team members to ensure the successful implementation of plans. This cross-functional collaboration is critical to maximizing Pfizer's investment in the customer-facing organization. Additionally, the leader will focus on operational efficiency and simplicity by streamlining processes, empowering the team to excel in their roles through enablement, and leveraging innovative thinking to gain a competitive advantage.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
Enabler of the PC CE team:* Spearhead sales force sizing, structuring, and targeting (SST) strategy and analytics, for assigned teams
* Owner for PC CE CEP customer engagement metrics and reporting


Point of Contact and key CE business partner to the assigned team; including Sales, Accounts, and Pfizer Connect LT.* Responsibility for collaborating with respective Sales, Pharmacy, Account Management, and Pfizer Connect Leadership
* Identify and enable Pfizer Connect to pursue the best opportunities to meet performance targets.


Team Leadership:* Lead and inspire a high-performing team members with strong SST analytics capabilities, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment to achieve business objectives.


Lead field force sizing, structuring, and targeting analytic efforts in partnership with Commercial Analytics & AI teams:* Partner with Primary Care Commercial Effectiveness Portfolio Lead on Strategic FF Planning and Deployment Considerations, including determining the size, structure, and targets for the sales team.
* Lead analytical work to ensure approaches are consistent with strategy, collaborating with Field Force Analytics COE, Data Science leaders, ISE partners, and Analytics Project Management team members
* Ensure the successful implementation of FF analytic plans, which are crucial for maximizing Pfizer's investment in the customer-facing organization


Rigorously measure and drive performance of the business:* Ensure business critical projects and initiatives are followed through by tracking progress against timelines and ensure key milestones are being met; help troubleshoot and de-bottleneck where needed
* Monitor sales force effectiveness (e.g., reps/ Pfizer Connect/ Navigators) and work with customer facing team leaders on operational enablement of teams
* Collaborate with Analytics Engineering on customized analytical support to address key business questions as appropriate

Metrics & Reporting* Track metrics and develop tailored dashboards by customer facing teams to drive business insights and action

title: Finance Manager, R&D Partner Lines
description:
Why Patients Need You
The Finance Manager, R&D Partner Lines role is a unique opportunity to serve as a strategic financial partner to certain Partner Line leads in the Pfizer Research and Development (PRD) organization, which leads support efforts from discovery to early and late phase clinical development. The PRD organizations supported by our team include Global Regulatory Sciences and Worldwide Medical and Safety (WMS).
What You Will Achieve
In this role, you will provide financial, operational, and strategic leadership support to the role’s leadership teams in a complex and dynamic environment to optimize budget allocation and maximize the value of the portfolio. You operate in a matrix environment with multiple stakeholders across different finance and R&D groups. Through insightful understanding of the pharma business, rigorous review, and partnership with Partner Line Leaders, you are responsible for providing financial advice and guidance on key business decisions, delivery of financial commitments, and ensuring optimal deployment of capital.
It is your hard work and dedication that will make Pfizer ready to achieve new milestones and help patients across the globe.
How You Will Achieve It
You will provide financial support for Partner Line leads in the Pfizer Research and Development organization (PRD) within the Regulatory organization. Responsibilities include:* Advise team and actively engage in investment decisions through understanding of the research and development strategies and cost drivers.
* Develop accurate and timely financial forecasts, provide detailed analysis, and proactively identify and communicate issues.
* Work closely with the partner line teams to provide business counsel and financial leadership on cost optimization initiatives as we seek to strike a balanced focus on strategic investments and cost efficiencies.
* Ensure integrity and accuracy of the financial statements and compliance with Pfizer policies and procedures, maintain strong internal control environment.
* Develop / maintain a strong partnership with the other R&D and BI Finance colleagues to develop and share best practices.


In this role, you will demonstrate the following skills:* Possess excellent presentation and communication skills.
* Strong analytical skills with capacity to provide clear, concise, and insightful analyses. Demonstrated ability to quickly identify problems and structure solutions. Attention to detail.
* Ability to plan and prioritize work on multiple projects, while maintaining high quality and meeting or exceeding deadlines.
* Strong business acumen and professionalism with the ability to interface effectively and build relationships with all levels of management and colleagues in diverse functional areas of the Company.
* Strong ability to lead, challenge, positively influence and drive change in a team and matrix environment.
* Self-starter who brings energy, enthusiasm and a positive attitude to responsibilities and projects.


Qualifications
Must-Have* Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or related field required.
* 5-7+ years of finance experience.
* Knowledge of SAP and fluency in Microsoft Office tools.
* Experience should include budgeting, forecasting, planning and analysis for a global organization.
* Knowledge of accounting and prior experience in monthly financial close activities.
* Ability to communicate financial concepts to business leaders and successful experience operating in highly matrixed organizations.
* Ability to work independently, under pressure and amid ambiguity.


Nice-to-Have* Pharmaceutical finance experience
* Experience with Oracle/Hyperion Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) applications and SAP Business Intelligence (SAP BI)
* Ability to apply continuous improvement mindset
* MBA and/or CPA
* Relevant professional skills including problem solving, project planning and delivery, attention to detail, time management, critical thinking


Other Job Details:* Last day to apply: October 8, 2024
* Work location assignment: Onsite 2 - 3 days per week or as the business requires.

title: I&I HIT Solutions Account Director
description:
Why Patients Need You
Everything we do, every day, is in line with an unwavering commitment to the quality and the delivery of safe and effective products to patients. Our science and risk-based compliant quality culture is innovative and customer oriented. Whether you are involved in manufacturing, testing, or compliance, your contribution will directly impact patients.
What You Will Achieve
I&I HIT Solutions Account Director will lead the I&I HIT strategic approach and customer engagement with identified leading health systems within the US. Working with defined leading health systems to help harness their EHR to improve diagnosis, treatment, and management of patients within aligned therapeutic areas that I&I Key Account Management engages. Examples include helping customers understand the value of optimizing their clinical workflow within these therapeutic areas while leveraging EHR technologies to support population health management. HIT Solutions Account Director provides strategic support and guidance for leveraging e-platforms to facilitate the evolution of care from a reactive episodic based care model to a predictive and proactive management of chronic illness across the care continuum.
Relevant functionalities include clinical decision support consistent with evidence-based guidelines (e.g., alerts, hard edits, screeners and order sets), standing orders/protocol orders, patient outreach and education (e.g. patient portals and reminders), bi-directional data sharing and measurement/reporting tools.
How You Will Achieve It* HIT Solutions Account Director will serve as Pfizer's Liaison working with customer's representatives (i.e., CIO, CMIO, Quality Director, EHR/EMR Vendors, etc.) responsible for Health IT related engagements within defined care projects and/or collaborations
* Serve as technical support to the broader Pfizer Account Management community to help them
* understand application of appropriate Health IT strategies, use of Health IT resources, and help
* assess Pfizer's needs related to the customer's needs and Health IT market evolution.
* HIT Solutions Account Director will provide input into RC approved, scalable, EHR/EMR enabled tools and resources in relation to key therapeutic areas.
* HIT Solutions Account Director will understand and be a strategic thought partner within the Pfizer Integrated Account Team for identified leading health systems within the US relating to care management evolution, quality and value-based care initiatives, and provider and patient satisfaction that impact HIT implementation and governance.
* HIT Solutions Account Director will serve as liaison across BUs for Health IT related issues and inform overall Health IT strategy
* Attend and share relevant insights from major Health IT conferences and Pfizer Health IT summits


MUST-HAVE* BA/BS degree required, Advance degree and certifications in a Health IT/Informatics related field required.
* Significant experience in the functional and technical application of health information
* technology

* including Leading Health Systems, Pharma, Payers, etc.
* Excellent organizational, written and oral communication skills are necessary to manage

title: Dispatcher - NJ
description:
DISCOVER WHAT’S NEXT FOR YOUR CAREER.



Join our team and immediately become part of the largest distributor of conventional, natural, organic and specialty products in the United States and Canada. We serve over 43,000 customer locations with 200,000 different products. Our Warehouse associates supply thousands of consumers with better for you food that nourishes families nationwide. Our retailers range from small family-owned stores to Whole Foods Markets and everything in between. Are you ready to make an impact on the lives of others and feel good about what you do? Join our growing Distribution team today!



PURPOSE:


* Responsible for dispatching trucks for on-time departure. Monitors drivers and shares info with effected customers to notify them of potential late deliveries or problems.



 Job Responsibilities:


* Percentage Processes customer invoices and assembles delivery paperwork.
* Monitors shipping and route progress in SCI and PeopleNet Link and verifies on-time arrivals.
* Breaks down driver packets and processes customer invoices.
* Collaborates with Customer for late truck notifications. May engage Customers Care for service escalations.
* Sorts, separates, and files invoices, route packets, and driver inspections.
* Completes data entry of equipment information, driver start/end times, and actual delivery times.
* Handles all incoming calls and emails. 10% Re-dispatch drivers as needed for coverage and to support on-time deliveries.
* Dispatch repair services for equipment break downs and handle accident reporting procedures.
* Maintains a clean and safe working environment.
* Reports violations of company policy to supervisor.
* Performs other relevant job duties as required.


Job Requirements:



Transportation/Dispatch experience preferred but not required



Knowledge/ Skills/ Abilities:


* Understanding of Safety guidelines
* Must have the ability to react to fast-paced, stressful situations in a calm, professional and efficient manner
* Ability to prioritize and work independently with good organizational and time management skills.
* Must have good communication skills including the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of employees.
* Astute, close attention to detail
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications
* Familiar with delivery routes and DOT rules and regulations
* Understanding of procedures in other areas of the warehouse for a more global understanding of all processes


PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT/ DEMANDS:


* Most work is performed in a temperature-controlled office environment.
* Incumbent may sit for long periods of time at desk or computer terminal.
* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.
* Incumbent may use calculators, keyboards, telephone, and other office equipment during normal workday.
* Stooping, bending, twisting, and reaching may be required in completion of job duties.
* Infrequently exposed to temperatures ranging from 20 degrees to 90 degrees Fahrenheit in the dock area or outside the work area
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. UNFI is an Equal Opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive and respectful environment for all. - M/F/Veteran/Disability. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: Orthopedic Bracing Specialist
description:
**Objective**

The Orthopedic Bracing Specialist will be responsible for applying durable medical equipment (DME) to patients for pre-operative and post-operative surgeries. The Orthopedic Bracing Specialist will work directly with Orthopedic Surgeons and medical personnel to ensure the well-being of patients and their activities of daily living.

**Key Functions**

· Manage patient schedules while servicing physicians and hospitals with patient’s orthopedic bracing needs

· Set-up, follow-up, and pick-up of all DME equipment in both the home setting or facility

· Measurement and fitting of Orthopedic Braces and other associated products

· Implement client teaching during the initial fitting and at any follow-up calls

· Perform environmental safety factors listed on Patient Plan of Care

· Complete all patient-oriented paperwork

· Perform other duties as assigned

**Competencies** 

· Strong written and verbal communication skills

· Ability to fit a patient and make necessary modifications

· Knowledge of the use and care of DME products

· Knowledge of equipment usage and maintenance

· Knowledge of infection control, patients right and responsibilities, Patient Care Plan, and advance directives polices and procedures.

· Ability to work independently and be confident in work

**Qualifications**

· Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Athletic Training or similar field such as Exercise Science, Kinesiology, and/or Movement Science

· Experience working with patients

· Must have reliable form of transportation and a valid driver's license

**About Synergy Orthopedics**

Synergy Orthopedics is a dynamic, rapidly growing Third Party Biller of Orthopedic Bracing and Rehabilitation products focused on serving Patients and Physicians in the PA, NJ, DE, MD and NY State areas for a wide range of Orthopedic and Podiatric rehabilitation and surgical needs.

Nationwide Court Services, Inc. seeks someone with solid title experience to fill a challenging role. Our company provides tax lien reports to multiple municipalities in NYS. The work is exciting and creative and requires reading, analyzing, and proofreading. This is a temporary seasonal position. The approximate dates would be from March until September or October.

By joining our experienced team, you will find the social knowledge-sharing group a great way to spend your working day.

Nationwide Court Services, Inc. has been in business for 39 years providing legal services to the tri-state area. Our employees have been honored with Woman under 40 awards, Entrepreneur of the Year, Number #1 Title Agency, have held multiple government contracts for over 20 years, and the list goes on. Join our team, and you too can be recognized for producing outstanding work in our industry.

Our team consists of six attorneys and we are looking to expand that number this year.

The wealth of Real Estate experience at our company is invaluable. Come join us, paralegals and attorneys to bring us back to pre-pandemic numbers of 155 employees.
