As a Fortune 50 company with more than 400,000 team members worldwide, Target is an iconic brand and one of America's leading retailers.


Working at Target means the opportunity to help all families discover the joy of everyday life. Caring for our communities is woven into who we are, and we invest in the places we collectively live, work and play. We prioritize relationships, fuel and develop talent by creating growth opportunities, and succeed as one Target team. At our core, our purpose is ingrained in who we are, what we value, and how we work. It's how we care, grow, and win together.

**ALL ABOUT GENERAL MERCHANDISE**


Experts of operations, process and efficiency who enable a consistent experience for our guests by ensuring product is set, in-stock, accurately priced and signed on the sales floor. The General Merchandise and Food Sales team leads inbound, outbound, replenishment, inventory accuracy, presentation, pricing and promotional signing processes for all General Merchandise (GM) areas of the store. This team leads Food & Beverage and Food Service, providing a fresh and food safe experience. Experts enable efficient delivery to our guests by owning pick, pack and ship fulfillment work.

**At Target, we believe in our team members having meaningful experiences that help them build and develop skills for a career. The role of an Offsite Warehouse Driver can provide you with the:**

* Knowledge of guest service fundamentals and experience supporting a guest first culture across the store
* Experience in retail business fundamentals including: department sales trends, inventory management, process efficiency and improvement
* Experience executing daily/weekly workload to support business priorities and deliver on sales goals

**As an Offsite Warehouse Driver, no two days are ever the same, but a typical day will most likely include the following responsibilities:**

* Create a welcoming experience by authentically greeting all guests
* Observe to quickly understand whether a guest needs assistance or wants to interact. Follow body language and verbal clues to tailor your approach
* Engage with guests in a genuine way, which includes asking questions to better understand their specific needs
* Be knowledgeable about the tools, products, and services available in the total store, and specific to your area, to solve issues for the guest and improve their experience
* Thank the guest in a genuine way and let them know we’re happy they chose to shop at Target
* Responsible for the transportation, preparation, loading and unloading of product to and from offsite in a safe and efficient manner
* Complete all required paperwork from vehicle to the offsite such as Bill of Lading and the driver vehicle inspection report
* Maintain the vehicle to ensure safe operation and follow designated routes established by store director for maximum efficiency
* Pull and backstock product accurately to ensure backroom and location accuracy
* Operate power equipment only if certified and partner with leader if certification is needed
* Safely and efficiently operate vehicle(s) following established routes, while following established routines and policies, including not using any mobile devices while driving
* Understand and leverage appropriate escalation tools to solve process and/or guest issues; notify leader(s) as needed
* Demonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, safety and compliance
* Work in a safe manner at all times to benefit yourself and others; identify and correct hazards; comply with all safety policies and best practices.
* Support guest services such as back-up cashier, order pick up (OPU) and Drive up (DU) and maintain a compliance culture while executing those duties, such as compliance with federal, state, and local adult beverage laws
* All other duties based on business needs

**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

**We might be a great match if:**

* Working in a fun and energetic environment makes you excited…. We work efficiently and as a team to deliver for our guests
* Providing service to our guests that makes them say I LOVE TARGET! excites you…. That’s why we love working at Target
* Stocking, Setting and Selling Target products sounds like your thing… That’s the core of what we do
* You aren’t looking for Monday thru Friday job where you are at a computer all day… We are busy all day (especially on the weekends), making it easy for the guest to feel welcomed, inspired and rewarded

**The good news is that we have some amazing training that will help teach you everything you need to know to be** **an Offsite Driver. But, there are a few skills you should have from the get-go:**

* Must be 21 years of age or older
* Must possess a valid driver’s license
* Must possess Class 4 Driver’s License (Hawaii only)
* Must possess a medical examiner’s certificate
* Must pass required road test (if applicable for your state) conducted by the store
* Understand and follow all traffic signs, directions, and signals
* Ability to communicate on multiple frequency devices and operate handheld scanners, and other technology equipment as directed
* Work both independently and with a team
* Capability to remain focused and composed in a fast-paced environment and accomplish multiple tasks within established timeframes

**We are an awesome place to work and care about our teams, so we want to make sure we are clear on a few more basics that we expect:**

* Climb up and down ladders
* Scan, handle and move merchandise efficiently and safely, including frequently lifting or moving merchandise up to 44 pounds
* Flexible work schedule (e.g., nights, weekends and holidays) reliable and prompt attendance necessary
* Complete all required training, certifications, and documentation provided by Target to ensure internal and federally mandated requirements are met
* Capable of working in and exposure to varying temperatures, humidity, and other elements while performing certain job duties including but not limited to Drive-Up, carryout, etc.
* Ability to remain mobile for the duration of a scheduled shift (shift length may vary)


Find competitive benefits from financial and education to well-being and beyond at https://corporate.target.com/careers/benefits.

**Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)**


Target will provide reasonable accommodations with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.

title: Dispatcher Hybrid Remote 6:30a-3p Schedule
description:
**Work in a Hybrid Role, 3 days a week in office 2 days a week from home**.

Are you interested in taking your career to the next step with an industry leader? Do you have a knack for scheduling, organizing, and planning? Then we have a job for you! We are a leading home services provider and due to our continued growth we are looking for responsible and reliable individuals to serve as Service Dispatchers.

As a Service Dispatcher, you will be the person our customers rely on to get service when they need it! You will prepare records and distribute work orders to Service Technicians in response to customer requests using our scheduling and mapping technology. We offer competitive compensation, benefits for full time roles as well as overtime opportunities. You may also find room for advancement with us. If this sounds like the kind of career move you've been wanting to make and you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!

**Responsibilities:**

As a Service Dispatcher, you will use your communication and active listening skills to devise the most efficient solutions.

**Specific duties include:**

* Scheduling service calls and providing work orders for Service Technicians according to urgency
* Reviewing jobs in the service monitor to ensure they are dispatched and assigned as required
* Communicating with other Dispatchers, Service Technicians and other departments

**Requirements:**

As a Service Dispatcher, you must be pleasant, professional and possess the ability to function equally well both independently and in a team environment. You must also be highly detail-oriented and focused with a flexible and adaptable nature. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal and active listening skills as well as the ability to interact effectively with both customers and coworkers.

**Specific qualifications include:**

* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* 1 -2 years prior dispatch experience preferred
* Prior experience in a customer service setting a plus
* Proven problem solving skills
* Ability to work well in a fast paced environment
* Proficiency with the MS Office Suite, MS Outlook and Web navigation

**Benefits:**

As a Service Dispatcher, you will be part of an evolving organization that built its reputation on providing our customers with the best possible service. Our employees are, of course, one of the main keys to our continued success and so, we are committed to your professional development. In addition, you may find opportunities for advancement to roles of greater responsibility with us.

Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including:

· Medical coverage (F/T staff)

· Dental coverage (F/T staff)

·Retirement Savings

·Plus more!

The hourly pay rate is $20 per hour.

***Build a rewarding career with an industry leader!***

***Apply now!***

***We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Every weekend
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Target Security Specialist
description:
Starting Hourly Rate / Salario por Hora Inicial: $21.00 USD per hour**ALL ABOUT TARGET**


As a Fortune 50 company with more than 400,000 team members worldwide, Target is an iconic brand and one of America's leading retailers.


Working at Target means the opportunity to help all families discover the joy of everyday life. Caring for our communities is woven into who we are, and we invest in the places we collectively live, work and play. We prioritize relationships, fuel and develop talent by creating growth opportunities, and succeed as one Target team. At our core, our purpose is ingrained in who we are, what we value, and how we work. It's how we care, grow, and win together.

**ALL ABOUT ASSETS PROTECTION**

Assets Protection (AP) teams function to keep our guests, team and brand safe and secure and lead through crisis events. They protect profitable sales by mitigating shortage risks, preventing, investigating and resolving theft and fraud to ensure product is available for our guest.

**At Target, we believe in our team members having meaningful experiences that help them build and develop skills for a career. The role of a Target Security Specialist can provide you with the:**

* Skills using intelligence-led tactics to keep team members and guests safe and secure
* Experience in crisis response, safety and crowd management; providing support to both guests and team members
* Skills in de-escalation as well as experience with recovering stolen merchandise to prevent shortage
* Ability to utilize Target's video surveillance system
* Ability to properly document cases using industry case management systems

**As a Target Security Specialist, no two days are ever the same, but a typical day will most likely include the following responsibilities:**

* Support sales by welcoming and engaging guests and team members at the front of store
* Lead a physical security culture for our team members and guests by assessing and maintaining safe and secure standards throughout the store, including exterior property
* Respond to and accurately document security incidents
* Understand and leverage escalation tools for guest issues in order to provide a safe and secure environment for our team members and guests
* Conduct productive merchandise recoveries and provide apprehension support as needed, strictly adhering to AP policies and procedures and AP leadership guidance
* Prevent theft and shortage at the front of store by performing receipt checks for exposed high-dollar merchandise
* Submit appropriate documentation in the system for all incidents following AP policy and procedures
* Understand and appropriately use the video system
* Model working safely while maintaining a clean store for guests and team members
* Provide service and a shopping experience that meets the needs of the guest
* Demonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, safety and compliance
* Work in a safe manner at all times to benefit yourself and others; identify and correct hazards; comply with all safety policies and best practices.
* All other duties based on business needs

**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

**We might be a great match if:**

* Working in a fun and energetic environment makes you excited…. We work efficiently and as a team to deliver for our guests
* Providing service to our guests that makes them say I LOVE TARGET! excites you…. That’s why we love working at Target
* Stocking, Setting and Selling Target products sounds like your thing… That’s the core of what we do
* You aren’t looking for Monday thru Friday job where you are at a computer all day… We are busy all day (especially on the weekends), making it easy for the guest to feel welcomed, inspired and rewarded

**The good news is that we have some amazing training that will help teach you everything you need to know to be a Target Security Specialist. But, there are a few skills you should have from the get-go:**

* Must be at least 18 years of age or older
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Meet any state or local licensure and/or other legal requirements related to the position
* Welcoming and helpful attitude toward guests and other team members
* Ability to communicate on multiple frequency devices and operate handheld scanners, and other technology equipment as directed
* Effective communication skills
* Work both independently and with a team
* Manage workload and prioritize tasks independently
* Capability to remain focused and composed in a fast-paced environment and accomplish multiple tasks within established timeframes

**We are an awesome place to work and care about our teams, so we want to make sure we are clear on a few more basics that we expect:**

* Climb up and down ladders
* Apprehend subjects in accordance with company policy
* Scan, handle and move merchandise efficiently and safely, including frequently lifting or moving merchandise up to 40 pounds
* Flexible work schedule (e.g., nights, weekends and holidays); reliable and prompt attendance necessary
* Capable of working in and exposure to varying temperatures, humidity, and other elements while performing certain job duties
* Ability to remain mobile for the duration of a scheduled shift (shift length may vary)


Find competitive benefits from financial and education to well-being and beyond at https://corporate.target.com/careers/benefits.

**Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)**


Target will provide reasonable accommodations with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.

title: General Manager
company: Ovando Floral Design and Event Production
description:
**General Manager Position Overview – Ovando**

At Ovando, the role of General Manager (GM) is instrumental in driving and delivering financial management, operational excellence, revenue growth, and healthy profitability. The GM is responsible for ensuring that all aspects of the business – financial outcomes, sales, customer service, floral quality, team performance – meet Ovando’s elevated standards, vision and goals. This role requires a passionate, focused, hard-working and caring leader that will foster a positive, collaborative, dynamic, and results-driven environment. As a key leader, the GM will work closely with the Founding Owner to implement initiatives that drive customer delight, business expansion and profitability.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Financial Management:**

· Lead the efforts to meet and exceed financial targets: manage the budget, cash flow, forecasting, financial reporting, payroll and control expenses.

· Analyze financial reports, including profit and loss statements, job profitability by markets and sales channels.

· Optimize operational efficiency to achieve financial targets and profitability. Identify areas for improvement.

· Implement cost control measures that maximize profitability without compromising quality or service.

· Work with accounting to ensure accurate and timely preparation of financial reporting.

· Develop and/or enhance, implement and enforce the organization's policies & procedures by way of systems that will improve the overall operation and effectiveness of the Finance Team

· Oversee AP and AR for timely collections and payments.

· Conduct monthly review of all financial activities: identify and resolve accounting discrepancies and reconcile intercompany accounts

**Operational Management:**

* Lead day-to-day operations ensuring efficient, smooth and flawless service and execution that drives customer delight and supports sustainable sales growth across all markets and sales channels
* Implement, enforce, refine and develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) that increase productivity, improve service and ensure excellence and consistency in operations and customer service across all customer touchpoints.
* Develop and implement KPI’s to monitor and ensure continued operational efficiency.
* Develop and manage relationships with key vendors and suppliers, ensuring quality, competitive pricing, and timely delivery of services and materials.
* Manage staff scheduling, ensuring adequate coverage during peak hours while managing labor costs.
* Execute and assist in developing strategies for new store openings and markets, supporting brand growth and profitability through successful new store launches.
* Ensure compliance with health, safety and labor regulations.

**Team Leadership:**

· Recruit, train, coach and manage high-performing team members that take ownership of their roles and responsibilities and contribute to a culture of accountability. Both front and back of the house teams.

· Collaborate cross-functionally with high-level communication abilities.

· Lead and grow teams, focusing on the development and empowerment of store leads and their teams.

· Ensure clear communication of Ovando’s purpose, individuals’ expectations and performance, and encourage a results-driven mindset.

· Conduct regular staff meetings to align and track goals, provide updates, and address any issues.

· Foster a positive work environment of open communication and teamwork. Be attuned and listen to individuals’ needs, ensuring that everyone has the support and tools to perform at their best and achieve job satisfaction, creating an uplifted team spirit and employee retention.

· Inspire and motivate the team to exceed performance expectations, driving both individual happiness and collective success.

**Customer Experience:**

* Ensure every client interaction reflects the Ovando brand ethos: delivering unparalleled exceptional customer service and an unforgettable positive experience that makes every customer feel special and valued.
* Address and resolve any client concerns or complaints professionally, thoughtfully and promptly, reflecting the company’s reputation for unparalleled service.
* Continuously monitor and gather client feedback and, identify and implement refinements to the overall client experience.
* Drive customer delight, loyalty and repeat business.

**Marketing and Sales Strategy:**

* Responsible for leading and driving top-line revenue strategies, developing sales goals designed to achieve budget and market share targets, managing the sales and marketing teams
* Guide and manage sales and marketing teams to develop and implement brand & marketing strategies that increase Ovando’s awareness, visibility and reputation.
* Guide and manage sales and marketing teams to create and execute sales-driven promotional strategies aimed at attracting new high-end customers and increase retention.
* Actively monitor and analyze local market trends and competitor strategies, to uncover new avenues for growth and revenue enhancement.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with local businesses, community organizations, and media outlets to raise brand visibility.
* Improve google ratings across all markets

**QUALIFICATIONS**

**Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree.
* In Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field preferred but not required.

**Experience:**

* 5-7 years of experience in luxury retail, luxury service or hospitality management, with a minimum of 2 years in a leadership role focusing on operational excellence, financial outcomes and revenue growth.
* Proven track record in successfully managing a team, operations, finances, and delivering results in a customer-facing environment.
* Strong understanding of operations, including inventory management, cost control, and customer service.
* Experience working directly with a very busy founder/owner, helping deliver a vision. Highly preferred, not required.

**Skills:**

* Must have proven financial acumen
* Outstanding leadership and team-building abilities
* Possess a growth mindset, adaptable to change, and effectively manage change processes.
* Demonstrated ER (Employee Relationships) and HR (Human Resources) knowledge
* Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills
* Exceptional communicator (written and spoken) with an emphasis on both clarity and efficiency
* Significantly skilled in managing multiple priorities
* Ability to anticipate and proactively manage potential issues
* Highly capable to work under pressure and in time-sensitive situations
* Professional and graceful with discerning and demanding customers
* Highly adaptable, flexible and able to pivot on priorities as needed
* Outstanding attention to detail
* Self-starter, self-managed
* Can quickly take direction and make things happen
* Superbly organized, thoughtful and prepared
* Empathetic, caring, displays Emotional Intelligence
* Passionate and eager to build something meaningful
* Proficiency in management software, sales reporting tools, and the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Knowledgeable on how to leverage new AI tools that enhance productivity (knows the advantages and downfalls of AI tools)

**WORKING CONDITIONS**

* A flexible schedule is required, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, depending on the needs of the business.
* The position is based in New York City, NY, with the potential for occasional travel to other locations.

At Ovando, we are seeking a General Manager who is a passionate leader, that embodies drive, grace and accountability. A GM who is committed to delivering both operational excellence and significant sales and profit growth.

OVANDO is an innovative floral and event design company that blends the sensibilities of visual art with the multidisciplinary practices of floral design, event décor, visual merchandising, and stagecraft. Ovando embodies this creative process through site-specific installations, providing beautiful, elegant solutions for a wide range of high-end projects and clientele. Our purpose-driven culture, distinctive design aesthetic, intentional craftsmanship and unparalleled customer service are the cornerstones of our success."

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10028 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Club Manager - Parkchester
description:
**Job Overview:**



We are looking for a Club Manager who can lead and inspire a team. This person will focus on anticipating and exceeding the members’ expectations by providing an unparalleled member experience. The Club Manager will continue to train and develop the team to ensure they embody the qualities of a Moodlifter; warm greetings, up-beat and positive energy, engages with members and prospects alike. The Club Manager will also ensure all policies and procedures are consistently followed.


**Responsibilities:**


* Build a winning team of Moodlifters through hiring, training, motivating, coaching and evaluating staff.
* Drive member count and ancillary business revenue to ensure the club is meeting and exceeding their targets.
* Partner with the Personal Training teams to guarantee a fully staffed team of productive trainers who are meeting and exceeding their targets.
* Spend time on the floor and at the front desk make sure we are delivering an exceptional member experience.
* Walk the floor of the club regularly to evaluate the cleanliness of the facility.
* Manage the payroll and supply expenses to ensure the club is within the budgets provided.
* Drive the sales of the retail and food and beverage product.


**Qualifications:**


* Proven leadership ability in an educational, fitness or professional setting.
* Minimum two (2) years management experience in a customer service business (Preferably Retail or Fitness)
* Proven ability to hire, direct and train staff.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Possess honesty and personal integrity.
* Be enthusiastic, energetic and personable.
* Passionate, intelligent and knowledgeable regarding the service and fitness industry.
* Computer literate.
* Hardworking and diligent.
* Excellent time management, organizational, problem solving and follow-up skills.


**Compensation & Benefits****:**


* Pay Transparency: Min $18 – Max $22.50/hr, ability to earn additional incentive bonuses
* Complimentary Blink membership
* Comprehensive benefits package
* And more


**Company Overview****:**



Founded in 2011 by executives at Equinox, Blink Fitness is a premium quality, value-based fitness brand with more than 100 locations open or in development throughout New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and California. Blink puts Mood Above Muscle™, which celebrates the positive feeling you get from exercise, not just the physical benefits.



Blink is an exciting and dynamic business that is still in the start-up mode. We are a passionate team with a great entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to roll up our sleeves to get the work done.



 For more information visit Blink’s consumer website - blinkfitness.com – and its franchise website – blinkfranchising.com.

title: RN Unit Manager*
description:
Hamilton Park Center for Nursing and Rehabilitationis looking for an RN Unit Manager to join the team at our Skilled Nursing Facility in Brooklyn, NY!


**Who We Are**


The Allure Group is a consortium of six rehabilitation centers across Brooklyn and Manhattan, NY, specializing in post-acute and sub-acute skilled nursing and rehabilitation. We pride ourselves on providing a high standard of care for patients of all ages and conditions while upholding an environment of kindness, dignity, and respect for employees and residents. As an **RN Unit Manager** at The Allure Group, you would be part of a winning team doing meaningful work to improve residents' quality of life, health, and comfort.


**RN Unit Manager Responsibilities**


* Evaluate the effectiveness of patient care and identities any issues that affect desired resident outcomes
* Assess, review, and maintain that daily resident care needs are met, and appropriate resident care is given
* Address resident and staff concerns to promote quality care
* Supervise staff nurses and CNAs to ensure their completion and quality of duties
* Make rounds of resident rooms to observe and evaluate residents' physical/emotional state
* Review order and care plans
* Provide direct nursing care as necessary
* Perform all assigned tasks in accordance with established policies and procedures
* Remain prepared to do any services or assignments within the scope of practice of an RN


**RN Unit Manager Requirements**


* Valid, current RN license
* Must be knowledgeable of nursing practices and procedures, and/or terminology, laws, regulations, and the guidelines that pertain to long-term care
* At least one-year experience in a supervisory capacity in a long-term care facility
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills
* COVID-19 Vaccination


**Preferred**


* Previous experience with Point Click Care


**What We Offer**


* Competitive pay scale
* Medical and dental coverage
* Generous employee referral bonus
* 401k
* Paid time off
* CEU-eligible training programs
* Ongoing leadership and professional development training
* Dedicated and local leadership support


Apply today! The opportunity for job satisfaction and growth for an RN Unit Manager position is here!

title: Advertising Specialist III
company: Resorts World Casino New York City
description:
**Job Description**

  



The **Advertising Specialist III** is responsible for assisting the Creative Director in all aspects of advertising projects, campaigns, direct mail creative, digital and traditional media various programs for the property; and ensuring branding standards are upheld throughout all campaigns and advertising efforts while embodying our core values of compassion, hard work, harmony, honesty, and loyalty.

  



This position is Shared Services and has responsibilities at Resorts World New York City, Resorts World Catskills, and Resorts World Hudson Valley. This position requires appropriate licensing for all properties.

  


**Essential Duties**


* Demonstrate empathy and understanding in interactions with team members and external stakeholders.
* Act as a liaison between the creative team and internal stakeholders, demonstrating empathy and understanding in all interactions to ensure satisfaction.
* Address internal stakeholder concerns and feedback with sensitivity and professionalism, working towards mutually beneficial solutions.
* Liaise with outside vendors to coordinate project deliverables and ensure alignment with company objectives.
* Assist in initiating, placing, and overseeing advertising projects requested from various Resorts World properties with dedication and diligence.
* Assist in tracking all aspects of the creative process and maintaining an accurate log of job progression.
* Collaborate closely with the Creative Director and senior management to define project objectives, establish project timelines, and allocate resources accordingly.
* Provide basic copywriting and brand standards and creative guidance for various marketing materials.
* Foster collaboration and teamwork by maintaining positive relationships with the internal advertising team, Resorts World properties, and other internal stakeholders.
* Cultivate positive relationships with Resorts World properties and other partners, facilitating smooth communication and cooperation throughout the project lifecycle.
* Act as a bridge between different departments and teams, promoting open dialogue, constructive feedback, and effective problem-solving to overcome challenges and achieve shared objectives.
* Uphold transparency and integrity in all communications and actions related to advertising projects and campaigns.
* Aid in the development of deliverable materials for media campaigns, ensuring they align with the company's values and objectives.
* Ensure that all advertising materials and campaigns adhere to ethical and legal standards, including compliance with industry regulations and guidelines.
* Demonstrate dedication and commitment to the success of Resorts World properties, aligning advertising efforts with the company's goals and objectives.
* Support front-line requestors and client teams by providing timely and accurate information, ensuring that advertising content and messaging are aligned with brand standards and objectives.
* Uphold company policies, procedures, and internal controls, promoting a culture of compliance and accountability within the advertising team.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Job Requirements**

  



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each job responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


*Physical and Mental Demands*



The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.



While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee is also regularly required to stand, walk, sit, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms, and to sit, climb or balance, and stoop, stretch, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl.



Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Essential responsibilities include moderate physical ability such as lifting or maneuvering at least thirty (30) pounds, and varied instances of standing/walking.


*Language Skills*



Ability to read, analyze, and interpret documents, such as policy and procedure manuals, maintenance instructions, and other related documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries from other employees or guests. Fluency in English required, second language a plus. Ability to write detailed instructions and correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations.


*Mathematical Skills & Reasoning Ability*



Ability to compute basic mathematical calculations. Ability to decipher various reports and maintain reports upon request.


*Work Environment*



The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that exists while team members are performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* The noise level in the work environment is typically moderate. When on the casino, kitchen, restaurant or property floor or some back of house areas, the noise level increases to loud. Must be able to interact with internal and external guests in a professional manner.
* Due to the unpredictable nature of the hospitality/entertainment industry, team members must be able to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the property.


*Work/Educational Experience*

  


* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Advertising, Communications, or related field.
* Proven experience in advertising trafficking or project management.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and project management software.
* Must be at least 18 years old, possess a high school or equivalent diploma and have the ability to obtain the appropriate license pursuant to the New York State Lottery regulations.
* Three (3) years’ related work experience


*Preferred Qualifications*


* Experience in the gaming or hospitality industry.
* Familiar with project management platforms/software such as Adobe Creative Suite.
* Familiar with creative processes including file management, printing, and digital platforms.

  


**Salary Range:** **$63,400.00** **to** **$95,100.00****USD**


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Payroll Manager
description:
**Payroll Manager**


Reports to: Controller


Seeking a highly skilled and experienced Payroll Manager with expertise in managing multi-state, multi-brand, and high-volume payroll processes. Proficiency in managing payroll functions for large workforces, conducting audits, and ensuring compliance with federal and state wage and hour laws is essential. This role requires strong problem-solving skills, the ability to work independently, and exceptional communication and relationship-building abilities.

**What You’ll Do**: The Payroll Manager is responsible for high volume, multi-state, multi-brand payroll functions and all tasks necessary to accomplish the organization’s payroll processing objectives. Maintains compliance with federal and state wage and hour and leave laws. Manages benefits, maintains ACA compliance, and overall Payroll/HRIS system maintenance. Supports Human Resources and Finance teams with reporting needs and internal and external information requests. Essential functions:

* Process weekly payrolls for multiple worksites (1500-2500 EEs) including wages, time off, premium pays, and required and elective deductions. Ensures compliance with all state and federal wage and hour laws. Ensures hours reported in POS and back-office system (SICOM/RTI) are accurately uploaded into payroll system. Conducts audits on each payroll and maintains documentation.
* Prepares monthly benefits eligible reports consistent with ACA compliance requirements, extends benefits offerings to newly eligible employees. Updates HRIS system with ACA documentation. Enters benefits enrollments and 401(k) contributions into systems and conducts monthly audits on all benefits programs.
* Manages all processes within Payroll/HRIS system, including onboarding, LOA, rehires, wage adjustments, transfers and terminations and coordinates with the operations team to ensure accurate and timely information input. Produces and maintains reports for audit purposes.
* Advises restaurant general managers as to Payroll/HRIS processes including time reporting, pay cards, and vacation time and balances.
* Responds to employment verifications and other payroll related requests including Child Support and other garnishment orders.
* Conducts year-end payroll processes, including W-2/1099 reporting.
* Serves as the Payroll/HRIS systems expert. Evaluates system functionality on an on-going basis and recommends upgrades/changes to management team for consideration.
* Manages related compliance filings: EEO; 5500 for 401(K); IRS form 720
* Manages third party payroll provider vendor relationship.

**What Will Make You Successful**:

* A minimum of 7-10 years of payroll management experience, including experience processing multi-state, multi-brand, high volume payroll.
* CPP Certification required.
* Experience with retail or QSR payroll a plus.
* Expertise in managing HRIS/Payroll systems and generating reports for audit and compliance purposes.
* Prior benefits management experience including ACA compliance and auditing.
* Prior experience implementing and communicating changes in federal and state wage and hour laws.
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word.
* Ability to work independently, with strong decision making and problem- solving skills
* Excellent communication and relationship building skills.
* Accounting Degree a plus.
* Demonstrated experience in process development and improvements.
* UKG Ready experience a plus.
* **Physical Requirements**: Ability to communicate via phone including hearing and talking. Ability to perform sedentary work such as computer-based work. Ability to utilize close visual acuity such as for creating and analyzing data/spreadsheets, word documents, and graphic designs.

**What You Can Expect from Us**:

* Competitive salary and bonus program
* 401(k) with company match
* Medical, dental, vision Insurance
* Paid time off
* Scholarship opportunities
* People-first culture
* Authentic, values-based leadership

**About Rackson Restaurants**:


Rackson Restaurants is recognized as one of the top QSR operators in the US with a strong growth strategy and a commitment to values-based leadership. Putting people first is at the core of our company culture. Come be a part of our all-star team!


Rackson Restaurants was founded in 2013 as a top-performing restaurant management company that challenges and rewards its team members to dream big. Led by our founder Chris Johnson, our values and maniacal attention to detail set the north star. We believe in taking outstanding individuals on a journey to grow an organization that will operate at a consistently high standard, long term, and provide our team members opportunities for growth along the way. To achieve this goal, we partner with iconic brands to operate great restaurants that make a meaningful impact in our communities. Most importantly, we have a lot of fun operating and growing the business every day!
  

Rackson's vision is to be one of the most highly valued multi-brand franchisees in the United States as a result of its disciplined focus on profitable growth and dedication to employee and guest satisfaction.  

We approach this goal through the lens of People, Process, Profit. We rely on our values - Fairness, Accountability, and Recognition - to help us get there.


Pay: $90000 - $110000 / year


Pay:

* Bonus pay


Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* 401(k) matching


Job Type: fulltime


Schedule:

* Monday to Friday


Education: Bachelor's degree


Work location: Flexible work from home options available

title: Accounting Associate
description:
The Accounting Associate supports financial reporting and accounting operations by performing duties relating to payment processing and expense management. The Accounting Associate is directly responsible for managing the Accounts Payable function and related processes in compliance with financial policies and procedures. The Accounting Associate will maintain processes and controls for receiving, processing, verifying and reconciling invoices in accordance with expense authorization limits and company governance. Responsibilities will also include annual 1099 and 1042 generation, monthly general ledger reconciliations, payroll processing activities and managing the corporate credit cards and Concur administration. Great Plains experience is highly preferred.



Key Responsibilities:


* Responsible for accurately and timely inputting invoices into the AP system
	+ Ensure proper authorization of all invoices.
	+ Ability to effectively perform a self-review of all assignments to ensure the most accurate output.
* Coordinate weekly check runs and process wires and auto drafts through the AP system, ensuring invoices are paid timely.
* Assists in monthly closings by ensuring receipt and entry of all period related invoices and assist in preparing related accruals, as necessary.
* Prepares monthly general ledger reconciliations as needed.
* Review accounts payable aging and reconcile system reports to general ledger balances.
* Maintenance of vendors in accounting system with required information including various addresses, federal tax ID numbers, payment terms, and other internal information that may be needed for reporting.
	+ Gathers W9's as needed and prepares end of year 1099 and 1042 filing.
* Maintaining electronic vendor records and invoices.
* Frequently communicates with various departments within the organization to obtain approvals on invoices.
* Communicates opportunities for improvements.
* Performs cross-training duties within the department and updates Standard Operating Procedures and work instructions as internal processes within the department change.
* Maintains Delegations of Authority
* Responsible for the day to day administration of Alfasigma USA’s credit card program and Concur expense tracking system, including card management and customer service support and training for cardholders and approvers
* Maintains Certificates of Insurance for the business, coordinating with legal, business and financial functions as needed.
* Assists with general support for the payroll processing function
* Other financial and administrative duties as assigned.


**Experience & Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 5 years of effectively managing the accounts payable process desired.
* Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system preferred, i.e. Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains or SAP
* Working knowledge of general accounting principles and standards
* Must be organized and communicate well
* Experience with Excel and Adobe Acrobat


**WHO WE ARE:**



Alfasigma USA is the local affiliate of the Italian based pharmaceutical company, Alfasigma. Alfasigma is a leading Italian pharmaceutical company focused on prescription drugs, over-the counter (OTC) and nutraceutical products and has a presence in 90 countries.



Alfasigma USA’s main goals are to improve the health and quality of life of patients by finding solutions to treat specific patient populations, expand our existing portfolio and bring new products into the US market. We strive to be a strong healthy company in a strong healthy world.



Alfasigma USA is headquartered in Bedminster, NJ. with a manufacturing plant in Shreveport, LA., a remote mail order pharmacy call center and an established national salesforce.


*Alfasigma USA, Inc. and its subsidiary, Brand Direct Health, L.L.C. (collectively the “Company”) is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, religious creed, religious observance, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (cancer and genetic characteristics), disability, military service, military and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on the Company.* Please email Human Resources at *applicant@alfasigma.com* *if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process****.***

  

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Assistant Athletic Director – Strategic Communications
description:
Position Information
**Job Title** Assistant Athletic Director – Strategic Communications
  

**Campus** Jersey City Campus
  

**Department** Athletics
  

**Full Time, Part Time, Adjunct** Full Time
  

**Job Description**
Saint Peter’s University Athletics is seeking highly motivated applications for the position of Assistant Athletic Director for Strategic Communications. The incumbent will serve as a dynamic thought leader within athletics department, overseeing all aspects of media relations, public relations and communications. He/she will oversee the strategic development and execution of content dissemination across all platforms, including web, digital, print, external news platforms and social media. The position focuses on aligning departmental public relations and athletics communications with marketing, ticketing, fundraising and recruiting initiatives. The incumbent will oversee day-to-day operations of the athletics communications department, including creating consistency among brand channels to ensure appropriate tone and voice in all communications, promotions, and marketing pieces.  

  

Salary Range: $50,000 – $52,000
  

**Duties & Responsibilities**
* Develop and implement a comprehensive multi-media plan to showcase programs, student-athletes, and events that will enhance the Athletics department and University brand reputation through comprehensive approach to public relations and media.
* Deliver the Saint Peter’s Athletics’ internal and external messaging and assist with marketing efforts to increase outreach and engagement with various constituent groups to enhance visibility of staff and student-athletes.
* Oversee a media relations/athletics communications plan for all sport programs while fostering productive relationships with local, regional, and national media outlets.
* Provide administrative leadership to full-time staff, graduate assistants, freelance and student staff/interns.
* Develop robust student athletics communications internship/practicum experiences for graduate assistant(s) and undergraduate students.
* Develop and plan work assignments for comprehensive coverage of all pertinent areas of communications and operations at home events, including the hiring and scheduling of stats crews/scoreboard/video board/operations support staff of select home events (soccer, volleyball, basketball, baseball, softball).
* Serve as the primary media contact for select sports, including men’s basketball.
* Assist in the production of digital marketing collateral and disseminate that content across all applicable platforms in a manner and voice consistent the department’s emphasis on instilling pride within all applicable audiences, in particular current and prospective student-athletes, as well as recent alumni.
* Write and deliver articulate and grammatically sound press releases on tight deadlines.
* Oversee design and creation of departmental publications, including game day program, posters, schedule cards, special event notices, and alumni/advancement material as appropriate for various sports and special events.
* Coordinate the daily maintenance and development of the official Saint Peter’s Athletics website and assure rosters, schedules, record books, etc., are updated in a timely manner and/or upon request from coaches/staff.
* Write press releases and feature stories promoting the department and its student-athletes.
* Serve as department spokesperson for all media requests for coaches, student-athletes and staff.
* Oversee historical archives and assure all pertinent website content is updated within a reasonable turnaround time at the conclusion of each season, including but not limited to: coach/staff/student-athlete bios, schedule archives, record book updates, updating rosters, photo galleries, etc.
* Pitch story ideas for Saint Peter’s University teams and student-athletes and provide stories when requested.
* Coordinate and present media relations training for coaches and student-athletes
* In collaboration with University and Athletics administration, establish protocol and best practices to effectively respond to crisis situations.
* Coordinate with external operations and marketing to increase awareness, attendance, and revenue for ticketed athletics events.
* Collaborate with marketing department on content and calendar of promotions, online sales, digital ads, etc.
* Interact with other University departments to promote athletics.
* Perform other duties as necessary to build support for and add value to the objectives and goals of the University, department of Athletics, and Athletics Communication unit.


  

**Qualification Standards**
* Previous experience preferably, in communications or public relations, within a college athletic department or professional sports organization;
* Extensive technological proficiency including experience with Adobe Creative Suite software (including InDesign, Photoshop and Premiere), Microsoft Office, NCAA LiveStats, StatCrew, SIDEARM websites and other relevant software programs necessary to perform the job duties described;
* Strong background in writing, editing, and design; in all forms of digital media (websites, social, video, mobile);
* Knowledge of effective public relations and communications strategies as they relate to intercollegiate athletics;
* Demonstrated ability to establish effective goal-oriented relationships with student-athletes, coaches, staff,
* University colleagues, media, and community members;
* Strong organization skills and ability to take initiative, multi-task, and achieve a high level of productivity in a collaborative environment under time sensitive deadlines;
* Ability to travel with select teams, including men’s basketball;
* Understanding of evolving trends and best practices in college athletics and social & digital media/fan engagement
* Ability to work effectively with a variety of people and units, including various stakeholders in the athletic department and across the institution.


  

**Education**
Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, Digital Media or a related field.
  

**Physical Demands**
  

**Experience**
The ideal candidate has previously worked in a college athletics setting, preferably at the Division I level, with experience in communications, media/public relations, sports information, etc., in addition to any undergraduate or graduate school experience. Proficiency with sport statistics programs such as Stat Crew and NCAA LiveStats; experience managing one or more team or departmental social media accounts; graphic design/illustration skills and experience as a public address announcer for one or more sports is also a plus.
  

**Licenses (if applicable)**
  

**Working Conditions**
Regular evening and weekend work is required depending on home athletics events (particularly men’s/women’s basketball, MAAC Championship events, etc.); Some work around holidays will be required; Some travel will be required, particularly with men’s basketball.
  

**Physical requirements**
Incumbent may be required to work outdoors for extended periods of time (i.e., soccer and baseball/softball home games)
  

Posting Detail Information
**Posting Number** PS448P
  

**Position Posting Date**
  

**Close Date**
  

**Open Until Filled** No
  

**Special Instructions to Applicants**
  

**Quick Link** https://saintpeters.peopleadmin.com/postings/3808

title: PGA Intern
description:
We are Athene. At Athene, we are driven to do more. We are a leading retirement services company that issues, reinsures and acquires retirement savings products designed for the increasing number of individuals and institutions seeking to fund retirement needs. We see every day as a new opportunity to measure ourselves against the best - and then we don't stop until we've set the bar even higher. We're ready to help you achieve more.  

Purpose:
Working at Athene is more than an internship — it’s a game changer for your career. Being an intern at Athene is seeing your idea come into fruition through collaborating with a team. It’s doing meaningful work with talented people. All internships are designed for you to create innovative solutions for our customers and the industry. Your internship is about making a difference in our communities. This is your chance to change the game with one of the leading retirement services companies in the United States. Qualified candidates must be enrolled at an accredited college or university for Fall term 2024.  

  

What you can expect as an Athene Intern:  

  

Professional development  

Social events  

Networking events  

Volunteer opportunities  

Community involvement  

Collaboration with other interns  

Paid housing option (if eligible)  

  

Internships will run from mid-May to early August  

  

The key goals of the internship include an introduction to US Pension Risk Transfer team responsibilities and development of a broad understanding of the company’s strategic growth initiatives in the PRT market. Intern will support the PRT team by performing tasks that contribute to the company’s key objectives and decision-making processes.  

Accountabilities:* Research and compile information from public filings related to companies that may be interested in pension risk transfer opportunities.
* Assist in preparation of presentation materials for meetings with senior management and for external meetings that take place in conjunction with each transaction.
* Collaborate in the preparation of transaction deliverables.
* Review Request for Proposals (RFPs) and deal documentation, summarizing key dates and details
* Monitor transaction activity and competitive landscape in the US.
* Automate and streamline processes where necessary.

  

Qualifications and Experience:* Pursuit of four-year degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, economics, finance or other related field required.
* Solid analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and effectively meet deadlines.
* Proficient organizational and communication skills and the ability to develop effective working relationships.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite preferred.

 *Annual Salary for this role is market competitive. Actual salary for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Depending on the role, a discretionary bonus plan or variable sales incentive may be included.*
Drive. Discipline. Confidence. Focus. Commitment. Learn more about working at Athene.
Athene is a Military Friendly Employer! Learn more about how we support our Veterans.
Athene celebrates diversity, is committed to inclusion and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Patient Experience Coordinator & Receptionist Dental
description:
#### **Treatment Coordinator**



Are you passionate about making people smile? Join Diamond Braces as a **Treatment Coordinator!** Enjoy growth opportunities, great benefits, and a supportive team that's all about creating world-class smiles. Ready to make smiles your business? We’d love to meet you!


#### **Why Diamond Braces?**



At Diamond Braces, your career growth is our priority. We provide continuous opportunities to learn, advance, and take on new challenges. As part of our team, you’ll have a clear path to success, with the support and resources you need to reach your professional goals while making a meaningful impact on our clients’ lives.


#### **What We Offer:**


* Competitive salary + performance-based bonuses
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance packages
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* 401(k) with company match
* Discounted orthodontic care for you and your family
* Ample growth & advancement opportunities
* Convenient office locations

#### **Essential Functions:**


* Educate Clients on Healthy Smiles: Help clients understand why a healthy smile is important by clearly explaining the long-term benefits of dental care. Make the treatment process exciting and easy to grasp.
* Guide Through Treatment Choices: Support clients in making informed decisions by providing simple, clear explanations of their treatment options and the benefits they can expect.
* Answer Questions: Use strong communication skills to respond to client inquiries, whether in person, over the phone, or via email, ensuring they feel well-supported and informed.
* Manage Appointments Smoothly: Keep the schedule running efficiently by optimizing appointment times, reducing wait times, and maintaining a smooth client flow.
* Greet Clients Warmly: Welcome every client with a friendly attitude, creating a comfortable and positive environment from the moment they walk in.
* Provide Clear Information: Make sure clients have all the information and documents they need, showing transparency and commitment to their care.
* Verify Insurance Details: Confirm clients' insurance eligibility, usage, and limitations. Follow up with them on their benefits and coverage as needed.
* Support the Dental Team: Assist dentists and other team members as needed, ensuring the practice operates smoothly and efficiently.
* Maintain a Clean Workspace: Keep your work area clean and safe, helping to prevent the spread of infection and protect the well-being of clients and staff.
* Stay Flexible: Be ready to handle any additional tasks as needed, adapting to the changing needs of the practice.

#### **Preferred Qualifications:**


* Bilingual abilities are a plus.
* Experience in retail, sales, or a similar customer-focused role.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in computer literacy.
* Managerial experience is an advantage.
* Clear long-term career goals aligned with our company values.

#### **Who We Are:**



At Diamond Braces, we believe in improving lives through healthier smiles. Our mission is to provide orthodontic care that is affordable, accessible, and delivered with amazing customer service. We’re committed to making every smile count, and we live by our **“No Smile Left Behind”** philosophy.


#### **Additional Information:**


* This position is full-time, and local travel between offices may be required.
* Salary is based on experience, skills, and qualifications.
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.


If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and help our clients achieve the smile of their dreams, **apply today!**

Concern Housing is seeking a Quality Improvement Coordinator who will participate in the overall execution of Quality Improvement and Compliance Department activities, including but not limited to audit activities, incident management, program support and policy and procedure implementation and administrative follow up. This individual also participates in Admission activities, including intakes.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

meetings, taking minutes, completing NIMRS reports, completing Precision Care Incident reports, completing quarterly  

and annual trend reports, incident follow up and tracking/gathering supporting documentation. Conduct incident  

investigations and post mortem reviews, as assigned and complete related follow up.

and provide troubleshooting and technical support as needed. Complete administrative follow up and track all problems

taking minutes and completing necessary follow up.

limited to, coordinating meetings, taking minutes and completing necessary follow up.

SHO and CR/CTAP programs; coordinating destruction of records which have reached retention across all departments  

and programs; maintaining retention and destruction logs and updating Concern’s Records Retention Schedule.  

* Participate in auditing activities, as assigned and assist with coordinating and/or facilitating administrative follow up.
* Maintain all Compliance/QI tracking systems to include the Compliance, Accounting of Disclosures, (including all


video footage and record requests), Grievance, Gift and Incident logs, and track and document all issues through  

resolution.

* Participate in troubleshooting and administrative support activities for various software databases including RHIO and


OMH database systems and provide training and support for the correct use of these systems including use of electronic  

devices, i.e., iPads.

and policies. Provide training to support implementation.

trends and outcomes.

Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree Required, Master’s Degree preferred plus a minimum of three years of relevant management experience in residential programs. Candidate should possess leadership qualities and be able to follow through on tasks independently. title: Court Communications Coordinator
description:
* Diana Diaz & Associates, LLC is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Courts Communication Coordinator. The ideal candidate will have experience in New Jersey Bankruptcy law cases, working directly with attorneys and clients. This is an in-person position, offering the opportunity to play a vital role in our legal team while working full-time hours.
* The Court Communications Coordinator is responsible for managing and monitoring all email communications received from the New Jersey Bankruptcy Court. This includes overseeing appointments, hearings, court appearances, and document requests. The coordinator ensures timely and accurate processing and dissemination of court-related information within the office. This role is critical in maintaining efficient and effective communication between the office and the court.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

**1. Email Management:**

* Email Monitoring: Continuously monitor the office's email inbox for incoming communications from the New Jersey Bankruptcy Court, ensuring no email goes unnoticed.
* Categorizing and Prioritizing: Sort and categorize emails based on their content and urgency, distinguishing between routine communications and urgent matters requiring immediate attention.
* Timely Responses: Respond to every email received from the court in a timely manner, acknowledging receipt and providing necessary information or updates as required.
* Accurate Responses: Ensure all responses are accurate, clear, and adhere to the legal standards and protocols.
* Follow-up: Track pending email responses and follow up on any unresolved issues, ensuring all court communications are addressed comprehensively.

**2. Appointment and Hearing Coordination:**

* Scheduling: Schedule appointments, hearings, and court appearances based on notifications received from the court, coordinating with clients and legal staff.
* Notification: Inform relevant staff members and clients about scheduled appointments, hearings, and court appearances, providing all necessary details and instructions.
* Preparation: Ensure all required documents and information are prepared and available for scheduled appointments and hearings, coordinating with the legal team as needed.
* Confirmation: Confirm appointments and hearings with the court and clients, and handle any rescheduling or cancellations as necessary.

**3. Document Management:**

* Receiving Documents: Receive and review documents requested by or received from the court, ensuring they are complete and accurate.
* Organizing Documents: Organize and file documents systematically for easy retrieval and reference.
* Submission: Ensure all required documents are prepared, reviewed, and submitted to the court on time, adhering to deadlines and legal requirements.
* Record Keeping: Maintain detailed records of all documents sent to and received from the court, including dates, content, and actions taken.

**4. Communication and Liaison:**

* Primary Contact: Act as the primary point of contact for all email communications with the New Jersey Bankruptcy Court, ensuring consistent and professional communication.
* Information Dissemination: Communicate court requests, updates, and information to relevant staff members and clients promptly and accurately.
* Professional Standards: Ensure all communication with the court and within the office is professional, clear, and compliant with legal standards and office protocols.
* Intake Coordinator Updates: Regularly update the Intake Coordinator on all court-related matters, providing detailed information and status updates on ongoing cases and communications.

**5. Record Keeping:**

* Detailed Logs: Maintain comprehensive logs of all email communications, including the date, sender, subject, and actions taken.
* System Updates: Regularly update internal systems and databases with relevant information from court communications, ensuring data accuracy and availability.
* Accessibility: Ensure all records are organized, up-to-date, and accessible for reference by authorized personnel.

**6. Process Improvement:**

* Efficiency Enhancement: Identify opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of email and document management processes, implementing best practices and new technologies where appropriate.
* Training and Support: Provide training and support to staff on email management protocols, court communication procedures, and document handling best practices as requested by Intake Coordinator.
* Feedback Implementation: Solicit feedback from staff and clients on communication processes and implement improvements based on their input.

**Qualifications**:

* Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen attention to detail.
* Proficiency in email management and office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Workspace).
* Understanding of bankruptcy procedures and legal terminology is a plus.
* Office-based work.
* May require occasional evening or weekend work to meet deadlines or attend meetings.
* Small office environment with a focus on teamwork and collaboration.
* Regular interaction with legal professionals, clients, and court personnel.
* Confidentiality: Role requires a high level of discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information. Signing of Non-disclosure agreement is mandatory
* **Other Requirements:**
* Must be available to work 5 days per week in the office, with the possibility of schedule adjustments based on case deadlines and court deadlines.
* A commitment to maintaining client confidentiality and professional ethics.
* Ability to adapt to changing case priorities and manage stress in a deadline-driven environment.
* Bilingual English/Spanish, a plus but not required.

**Performance Metrics:**

* Timeliness and accuracy in managing case files and meeting court-imposed deadlines.
* Effective and professional communication with clients, attorneys, and court personnel.
* Accuracy and thoroughness in preparing legal documents and conducting legal research.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize competing responsibilities without compromising quality.
* Maintenance of client confidentiality and adherence to the Office’s ethical standards.

**Work Environment**:

This position requires regular in-office work at the Office. The environment is fast-paced and requires the ability to handle confidential information and sensitive legal matters with professionalism.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Monday to Friday

* Bankruptcy: 2 years (Preferred)

title: Per Diem Facilities Custodian
description:
Concern Housing is seeking a Per Diem Facilities Custodian to be responsible for the routine, general cleaning of the building and cleaning of the individual apartments in the building.
  
  

**Position:** Per Diem Facilities Custodian
  
**Location:** Brooklyn Locations
  
**Schedule:** Per diem - as needed basis
  
**Salary:** $16.00/hr.
  
  

**Duties and Responsibilities:**  

Vacuum offices, hallways, stairs, lobby, lounge area, exercise room, conference room and all other common areas
  
  

Dust all office furniture, windowsills, countertops, etc.
  
  

Empty office, bathroom, lounge, exercise room, conference room and all other common area wastebaskets
  
  

Clean bathroom fixtures, counters, mirrors, and mop floors
  
  

Assure adequate supplies are in bathrooms
  
  

Clean building floors by sweeping, mopping, scrubbing, or vacuuming them
  
  

Maintain adequate stock of all custodial supplies, ordering additional as needed
  
  

Follow procedures for the use of chemical cleaners
  
  

Notify managers concerning the need for major repairs
  
  

Remove snow from sidewalks, driveways, and parking areas, using snowplows, snow blowers, and snow shovels, and spread snow melting chemicals
  
  

Maintaining the cleanliness of the exterior of the building including removing debris from the property, sweeping patios and walkways as needed
  
  

Set up, arrange, and remove decorations, tables, chairs, and ladders to prepare facility for events such as banquets and meetings
  
  

Spray insecticides and fumigants to prevent insect and rodent infestation as allowed by law and with proper protection
  
  

Dust, clean and maintain exercise equipment
  
  

Minor maintenance repairs as needed including changing light bulbs, filters etc.
  
  

Wearing proper Personal Protective Equipment at all times
  
  

**Cleaning of individual apartments:** kitchens, bathrooms, flooring, dusting of blinds, emptying trash baskets
  
  

Assist Maintenance Mechanic and/or Superintendent when needed
  
  

Remain current with all Agency required compliance documents and trainings.
  
  

**Major periodic cleaning:**  

Wash inside and outside of all windows, as assigned
  
  

Wash off marks on walls and doors
  
  

Dust door ledges and floor boards
  
  

Dust chair/furniture legs
  
  

Scrub bathroom floor, walls, and fixtures
  
  

Clean and/or shampoo carpeting and upholstery
  
  

Coordinate moving or set up of furniture to individual units
  
  

May be required to assist with the clean up of areas damaged by residents
  
  

**Requirements:** High School Diploma (preferred) along with 6 months or more related experience (preferred). Good communication and interpersonal skills, client/customer service skills and ability to follow oral and written instructions. Must have the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and work effectively with a team. Must have basic knowledge of cleaning products. The work requires routine walking, standing, bending and carrying items weighing less than fifty pounds and moving items over fifty pounds utilizes a team lift.
