b. Wells Fargo requires you to directly represent your own experiences during the recruiting and hiring process.
company_description: At Wells Fargo, we provide opportunities that go beyond just your career. Whatever living a well life looks like to you, you'll find it here. Learn more at wellsfargojobs.com/well-life.

title: Mortgage Loan Processor
description:
**About Tomo**



Tomo’s mission is not just to make homebuying joyful, or to make homebuying easy, or to make homebuying fast. Tomo’s mission is to advantage the homebuyer. Everyone else is in line ready to take their cut from a homebuyer - and all too often that cut is not deserved. We are by their side trying to give them a leg up, trying to give them information others don’t have, give them advice others don’t have, give them a lower cost that others don’t have - all that they can use to achieve better outcomes than they’d be able to otherwise.

  

### **The elevator pitch…**



Tomo is growing our mortgage operations team, and we’re looking for our next GOAT! A Mortgage Loan Processor leverages established guidelines to ensure loan applications are accurate, and include compliant supporting documentation.



Our team’s ultimate goal is to work closely and collaboratively to achieve on-time closings, while building a memorable experience for our customers.. We are looking for resourceful Processors with proactive pipeline management skills and excellent intuition about customer experience and needs. The ideal candidate for this role gets excited about moving quickly, using technology, innovating, and being around customer-centric teammates.


*This role is based in our office Monday- Wednesday, and is remote optional on Thursdays and Fridays. This role is based in Seattle, WA, Stamford, CT or Detroit, MI.*


**The things you’re a GOAT at…**


* Serve as the primary relationship manager and point of contact for the customer from rate lock to close, collaborating with other functions to make this happen
* Perform all processing, pre-underwriting, and pre-closing tasks required to proactively manage mortgage loan files from receipt in processing to final disposition
* Verify accuracy and adherence to investor guidelines of all documents required for a complete submission to Underwriting (including appraisal and title)
* Collaborate with the agent to obtain necessary documentation (if needed) for approval and keep him or her informed of the status of the application
* Use Tomo's tools to proactively communicate with the customer and keep them informed throughout the loan process
* Consistently meet target service level objectives
* Initiate follow-up phone calls to members and third parties to obtain necessary loan documentation, title, credit and/or collateral information
* Meet stated objectives for quality submissions to Underwriting
* Maintain proactive review of pipeline to ensure that rate locks do not expire
* Coordinate closings with all parties and assists with post-closing follow-up, as necessary
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and serves as a project resource in the implementation of system enhancements or process improvements
* When Closing Disclosure is sent to customer, offer option to review and answer questions

### **The things you’ll be doing…**


* Understanding of the mortgage lending process
* Ability to handle multiple purchase applications simultaneously in a fast paced environment - On time close is very important to us!
* Strong written and verbal communication
* Strong performance in team environments
* Detail orientation with a strong focus on quality
* Superior customer centricity

### **You may also have the extras…**


* Bachelor’s Degree
* 2+ years experience of mortgage loan processing specifically purchase transactions
* Ability to obtain and maintain NMLS registration
* Byte Experience
* Non-QM and broker experience/knowledge
The expected annual compensation for this position will be between
$65,000—$75,000 USD
company_description: New homes bring joy. We think buying them should too.

title: Building Maintenance Worker
description:
IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:* Upload Resume or Curriculum Vitae for automatic population of information to the application.
* The contact information, work experience, and education listed on your Resume/CV will be parsed and input into your Montclair application.
* Review information and double-check all fields containing information that the system parsed – the software is intelligent, but you need to verify that the data is accurate.
* In the “My Experience” section, you will find a Resume/CV upload option where you can submit your cover letter and all other supporting documents.


Note: If you have an expansive CV, we recommend that you apply manually and only include the positions you have held in the last ten (10) years. You will then be able to attach your Resume/CV, as well as all other supporting documentation in the "My Experience" section of your application.
Job Description
SUMMARY:
Reporting to the Crew Supervisor and/or Assistant Housekeeping Supervisor, the Building Maintenance Worker is responsible for maintaining cleanliness of the Montclair State University Facilities.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:* Cleans campus facilities alone or in teams; cleans public areas and meeting spaces.
* Performs room set-ups; replaces light bulbs, cleans light fixtures and restrooms.
* Sweeps, mops, strips and waxes, buffs floors; vacuums and shampoos carpets.
* Collects and removes trash, brings trash to curb or receptacles, transfers recyclable materials.
* Dusts all surfaces and vents, and cleans inside window surfaces.
* Cleans desks, tables, chairs, and removes graffiti.
* Cleans offices, classrooms, and work areas.
* Performs snow removal as directed.
* Attends in-service training and participates in University quality and processing improvement initiatives.
* Assists with the sorting, distribution, transportation and storage of cleaning supplies.
* Keeps janitorial closet stocked and clean; maintains housekeeping equipment.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
* Management retains the right to add or change job duties at any time.


QUALIFICATIONS:
REQUIRED:* Ability to speak, read, and understand English.
* Ability to lift 25 lbs. and use a ladder.
* Ability to work any shift, overtime and holidays in the performance of assigned responsibilities.


PREFERRED:* A high school diploma or its equivalency.
* Housekeeping experience in a university, school or hospital setting.

* NOTE: This is a Civil Service position. As required by the State of New Jersey, in order to be certified to the position and attain permanent status in title, candidates are required to successfully serve a 4-Month Working Test Period.


This position is designated as essential. The designation of essential requires employees at these 24/7 facilities to be present due to inclement weather situations. This position requires on campus work and is not a position that allows remote work.
SALARY RANGE: O09: $36,071.74 - $50,192.11 \\*NOTE: Salaries for internal candidates are determined by the New Jersey Civil Service Commission’s formula. Salaries for external candidates are determined up to step four, $40,778.53.*NJ SAME Applicants*
This position is a non-competitive, unclassified posting and complies with the NJ SAME Program. If you are applying under the New Jersey "SAME" program, your supporting documents (Schedule A or B letter), resume (CV), as well as the names and contact information for three professional references should also be sent to: same@montclair.edu and hrcompliance@montclair.edu
For more information on the SAME program visit their website at: https://nj.gov/csc/same/overview/index.shtml, email: SAME@csc.nj.gov, or call CSC at: 833-691-0404.
In accordance with the New Jersey First Act P.L. 2011 c.70, effective September 1, 2011, new public employees in certain positions (other than faculty who are exempt) are required to obtain New Jersey residency within one (1) year of employment. Applicants who have a concern with meeting this requirement should discuss with Human Resources if the position for which they have applied is eligible for an exemption from this requirement.

Services

title: Postal Clerk
description:
IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:* Upload Resume or Curriculum Vitae for automatic population of information to the application.
* The contact information, work experience, and education listed on your Resume/CV will be parsed and input into your Montclair application.
* Review information and double-check all fields containing information that the system parsed – the software is intelligent, but you need to verify that the data is accurate.
* In the “My Experience” section, you will find a Resume/CV upload option where you can submit your cover letter and all other supporting documents.


Note: If you have an expansive CV, we recommend that you apply manually and only include the positions you have held in the last ten (10) years. You will then be able to attach your Resume/CV, as well as all other supporting documentation in the "My Experience" section of your application.
Job Description
SUMMARY:
Reporting to the Principal Postal Clerk, the Postal Clerk receives and delivers common carrier packages and delivers in-house packages and correspondence (filled Central Stores requisitions) to all campus departments. The Postal Clerk also sorts, weighs, meters, and delivers campus mail. Additionally, the Postal Clerk may be trained to be a Passport Agent.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:* Unload incoming shipments from all trucks, and deliver UPS/DHL and all common carrier packages to all campus departments.
* Collect letters to be mailed, wrap, weigh, and stamp outgoing packages ensure proper postage and handling.
* Record registered, insured, and valuable letters, packages and express mail as required by federal regulation.
* Help unload and drive the mail truck, as required, to ensure continuity of service.
* Operate and perform routine maintenance on machines including: inserting and sealing machines, (electronic remote) meter machines, (perforated machines), automated presort machines, other presort operations, and remote accounting system electronic scales. Perform the clerical duties related to their use.
* Serve all walk-in customers, including students, faculty, staff and contractors.
* Perform the work involved in receiving, date-stamping, and distributing incoming letters and packages. Obtain required signatures when necessary.
* Perform the work involved in folding, inserting, sealing, and labeling operations, including maintaining, servicing, and repairing related machines.
* Make regular and special runs for the collection of outgoing interoffice mail. May drive, load, and/or unload the mail truck as necessary.
* Prepare outgoing mail for delivery to a state department post office; will weigh, stamp, and deliver outgoing mail directly to the U.S. Post Office.
* Closely adhere to collection and delivery schedules and makes necessary adjustments to expedite emergency and peak mail loads.
* Move packages and items from the mail receiving area to the storage area as needed. Sort and place Warehouse materials or items in designated places. For arrivals that require immediate attention, contact recipient if the area where items are to be stored is unknown.
* Provide delivery of most packages to central distribution points in the various academic and administrative buildings.
* Mark packages with identifying information using appropriate methods. Record receiving and shipping information as required for inventory or other purposes.
* Assist customers on the telephone and at the service counter. Ensure that all staff and customers are treated with respect and courtesy.
* Scan tracking numbers at the time of delivery. Create labels for packages without tracking numbers. Obtain signatures at the time of delivery after scanning tracking numbers. Upload mobile devices to PC and back up deliveries daily.
* Ensure that information flows freely across the unit.
* Participate in meetings and planning sessions as directed.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Management retains the right to add or change job duties at any time.


QUALIFICATIONS:
REQUIRED:* Must possess a valid NJ driver’s license to operate Central Receiving Vehicles.
* Ability to read, write, understand and communicate in English.
* Basic computer skills.
* Ability to operate efficiently in a positive team environment and to communicate clearly and effectively.


PREFERRED:* Experience loading and unloading trucks.
* Forklift experience in a warehouse setting.
* Experience sorting mail/ packages.

* NOTE: This is a Civil Service position. As required by the State of New Jersey, in order to be certified to the position and attain permanent status in title, candidates are required to successfully serve a 4-Month Working Test Period.


This position is designated as essential. The designation of essential requires employees at these 24/7 facilities to be present due to inclement weather situations. This position requires on campus work and is not a position that allows remote work.
SALARY RANGE: A09: $36,741.05 - $51,126.92 \\*NOTE: Salaries for internal candidates are determined by the New Jersey Civil Service Commission’s formula. Salaries for external candidates are determined up to step four, $41,536.34.*NJ SAME Applicants*
This position is a non-competitive, unclassified posting and complies with the NJ SAME Program. If you are applying under the New Jersey "SAME" program, your supporting documents (Schedule A or B letter), resume (CV), as well as the names and contact information for three professional references should also be sent to: same@montclair.edu and hrcompliance@montclair.edu
For more information on the SAME program visit their website at: https://nj.gov/csc/same/overview/index.shtml, email: SAME@csc.nj.gov, or call CSC at: 833-691-0404.
In accordance with the New Jersey First Act P.L. 2011 c.70, effective September 1, 2011, new public employees in certain positions (other than faculty who are exempt) are required to obtain New Jersey residency within one (1) year of employment. Applicants who have a concern with meeting this requirement should discuss with Human Resources if the position for which they have applied is eligible for an exemption from this requirement.

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
**Who we are:**



K Health is venture-backed, fast-growing startup with a mission to use the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to get everyone access to higher quality healthcare at more affordable costs. We're looking for mission driven individuals to join our team and help us eliminate healthcare inequalities to build a better and healthier future.



Featured most recently in Forbes and Business Insider as a leading AI startup, K Health is a telehealth company that harnesses the power of technology to help provide the smartest digital healthcare platform to patients, hospital systems, and providers across the United States. Our AI powered application helps bring together the knowledge of thousands of doctors and anonymous medical data to provide the highest quality care to our patients. We offer a free symptom checker, 24/7 access to board-certified doctors, ability to refill prescriptions from your phone, and more. All within one application - no insurance or preauthorization required.



K Health was founded in 2016, and has partnered with visionary and leading hospital systems and providers such as Cedars-Sinai, Mayo Clinic, and Elevance Health. Join us on our mission to help provide better healthcare for less.

**About the role:**



K Health is looking for a highly self motivated, responsible, compassionate, reliable, hardworking full-time, permanent position to join a dynamic and rapidly expanding mail order pharmacy team.


This is a closed door Pharmacy, Monday through Friday schedule. You will be paid $18-$24 an hour based on experience and be able to work full-time. We are located in Armonk, NY and this role will require you to commute to the Pharmacy.


**What you'll do:**


* Work closely with our customer experience team and collaborate on making it a flawless K Health user experience
* Organize and work closely with the Staff Pharmacist to expand operations
* Process and fill prescriptions as directed and assisted by the Staff Pharmacist
* Actively participate in quality assurance measures implemented by the company
* Help maintain cleanliness in the working environment; tools, automation, shelves, etc
* Assist in onboarding new employees


**What we're looking for:**


* Vibrant positive attitude
* Excellent customer service and computer skills
* Very organized and detail oriented
* Ability to process and fill prescriptions as directed and assisted by the pharmacist
* Ability to take constant positive/negative feedback for growth and development
* Ability to work in a fast paced environment
* Innovative thinker; thinks of ways to simplify and improve pharmacy experience
* Excellent communication skills
* Actively participate in quality assurance measures implemented by the company
* Able to lift light weight (up to 30 lb)
* Able to perform other pharmacy delegated tasks


**Qualifications:**


* Minimum high school diploma required
* Minimum 1 year experience in a retail, hospital or mail order pharmacy, preferred
* Must be over the age of 18
* Must be willing to travel to our Armonk pharmacy location
* CPhT preferred, but not required


**Benefits & Perks:**


* Monthly social committees for company events
* 18 vacation days, 5 sick days, and 2 personal days
* 9 company holidays
* Stock options for every full-time employee
* Paid parental leave
* 401k benefit
* Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance options
* Monday - Friday, 9a-5p working hours

  

We offer competitive compensation packages based on industry benchmarks for function, level, and geographic location. Offer amounts are determined by multiple factors such as a candidate's experience and expertise.



We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, citizenship, military or veteran status, or any other class protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws. We're deeply committed to building teams as diverse as the patients we serve and strive to cultivate an environment where everyone can bring their most authentic self to work. We depend on our differences to make our team stronger, our workplace more dynamic, and our product accessible to all of our users.



We are committed to maintaining the integrity of our hiring process and ensuring a safe environment for all candidates. All communication for job offers from K Health will come from email addresses ending in @khealth.com. K Health will never ask you to provide financial information about yourself during the recruitment process. We will never use personal email accounts or other domains for official correspondence. Our official job postings are only listed on our official website and reputable job boards. Be cautious of job offers from sources other than these platforms.

title: Talent Acquisition Manager | US
description:
**About Us**
------------



At Blank Street, we believe that rituals matter, and that great rituals make your life better. With coffee shops across the US and UK, we are working to transform the high street grab-and-go coffee transaction into an experience that is higher in quality, hospitality, and joy.


**What's Brewing…**
-------------------



Blank Street is seeking a dynamic and strategic Talent Acquisition Manager to lead and innovate our talent acquisition space. This role requires an experienced professional who can operate with autonomy, partner across functions, and help drive our employer branding efforts. You will own the full talent acquisition lifecycle, from identifying top-tier talent to partnering with leaders on effective hiring processes, all while leveraging data to refine and enhance our recruiting strategies.



This role will work with stakeholders across the business to recruit for our Baristas, Multi-Unit Store Leaders, and HQ roles in the US. You will work to provide an incredible candidate experience to applicants all while managing a high requisition load in a fast paced environment. This role is an in-person position based out of the Brooklyn, NY HQ office and will report into the Global Senior Director of People.


**Our Values**
--------------


* **Magic is in the Details:** We value attention to detail in everything we do. We're always thinking about the small things that make a moment meaningful.
* **Move as One:** We value people who strive to be the best team player, not individual stars.
* **"My Home is your Home" Hospitality:** We look for individuals who treat others the same way they'd treat a guest in their home. We care about presentation, hospitality, and having fun even when things are stressful.

**What You'll Own:**
--------------------


* **Lead Store-Level Hiring**: Support operations in hiring service pros, baristas, and shift leaders to ensure stores are staffed with top talent.
* **Partner with Hiring Managers**: Work closely with managers to source, attract, and select best-in-class talent aligned with our culture and values.
* **Employer Branding**: Collaborate with marketing, creative, and executive teams to develop and execute a robust employer branding strategy, making the company a talent magnet.
* **Data-Driven Recruitment**: Analyze hiring metrics to identify gaps and opportunities, and develop solutions to improve talent acquisition outcomes.
* **Continuous Improvement**: Build feedback loops with the HRBP, Operations, Learning & Development Manager, and Hiring Managers to iterate and improve hiring processes.
* **Training Support**: Develop impactful training for hiring managers to enhance their recruitment capabilities.
* **Innovative Recruitment Strategies**: Experiment with creative ideas to innovate the talent acquisition process and elevate the candidate experience.
* **Compensation Benchmarking**: Conduct pay band research and general compensation benchmarking to ensure competitive offers.
* **ATS Management**: Own and maintain Blank Street's ATS, ensuring it supports a seamless recruitment process for both internal and external stakeholders.
* **Full Lifecycle HQ Talent Acquisition**: Support recruitment for HQ roles across local and global departments based in the US, owning the job requisition process, candidate intake, screening, and interview coordination.

**Who You Are:**
----------------


* **Extremely Organized**
	+ Proven ability to strategize and collaborate with multiple functions across an organization
	+ Comfortable managing your own workstreams while also working under direction from leadership
	+ Expertise in project management, with strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively
* **Proactive & Solution Oriented**
	+ Data-driven mindset, using insights to identify recruitment gaps and propose solutions
	+ Ability to create and deliver on long-term talent solutions
	+ Agile, with the ability to pivot and adapt to changing business needs
* **Exceptional Communicator**
	+ Strong emotional intelligence, with the ability to connect with and understand the needs of stakeholders at all levels
	+ Able to deliver feedback constructively and tailor messaging to various audiences
* **Passionate about hospitality and retail**
	+ You're passionate about Blank Street and coffee. Loving what you do makes the job even sweeter

**Qualifications****:**
-----------------------


* 4+ years of experience in Talent Acquisition or Recruitment
* Experience working with ATS platforms and recruitment marketing tools
* Familiarity with compensation benchmarking and pay band research
* Strong project management skills and a process-oriented mindset

**Benefits:**
-------------


* $80,000 - $110,000 annual base salary
	+ *Blank Street, in good faith, believes that the posted salary range is accurate for this role in New York City at the time of posting. Our salaries are rooted in the desire to pay competitively relative to our organization size and industry, reflecting just one part of the total compensation package. Additional components include equity, healthcare benefits, paid time off and various work perks (commuter benefits, free coffee). Details will be discussed during the interview process. Blank Street may pay more or less than the posted range based on factors such as relevant experience and skills, qualifications and location, among others. This range may be modified in the future.*
* Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage. Blank Street covers the full premium for low and mid-tier employee-only plans.
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off + company holidays
* Paid parental leave benefits
* Equity
* Learning and development opportunities. We're growing and we'd like for you to be a part of the journey.
* A whole lot of Blank Street swag & coffee

title: Summer 2025 Internship – Purchasing
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*



Summer 2025 Internship – Purchasing



Application Deadline: November 15, 2024



We encourage you to submit your application as soon as you can as internship applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.



Internship Dates: June 9, 2025 – August 15, 2025 (You must be available to work during this period)



About our Organization:



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



About the Role:



Dow Jones is looking for an organized individual for a Purchasing internship. You will report to the Manager, Purchasing and have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the field of Purchasing while working with a team of experienced professionals. You will participate in project work, including a purchase order review/clean-up project. You will also assist in the day-to-day operations involved in purchasing.



This role is a hybrid, based in our Princeton, NJ office.



You Will:



+ Review purchase requisitions in SAP for accuracy and release for business and finance approval



+ Help with project related work around closing out expired purchase orders



+ Facilitate three way match process via invoice workbench exceptions



+ Work with designated business groups and Finance to get necessary information to complete work accurately and in a standard process



+ Work with business users and Finance groups to research and resolve tax, sourcing, invoice, or budget issues



+ Collaborate with team members on management of shared email boxes and internal ticketing system



+ Assist employees with P2P end to end process queries



You Have:



+ At least one year of school completed, working toward a Bachelor’s degree



+ A GPA of 3.0 or higher



+ Previous relevant internship or part-time work experience



+ An analytical approach to solving problems



+ Excellent communication, organizational skills, and follow-up skills with strong attention to detail



+ Competency with the MS Office Suite, particularly Excel



#LI-Hybrid



Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy – We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put “Reasonable Accommodation” in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.



Business Area: Dow Jones – Finance



Job Category: Administration, Facilities & Secretarial



Union Status:



Non-Union role



Pay Range: $25.00 – $25.00



We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate’s experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.



Pay-for-performance is a key element in our strategy to attract, engage, and motivate talented people to do their best work. Similarly to salary, for bonus eligible roles, targets are set based on a variety of factors including competitive market practice.



For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including “elective” benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..



Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.



This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.



\\*\\*If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view “Find Jobs – Dow Jones.” Thank you.\\*\\*

description:

Summer 2025 Internship – Social Media Intern



\\*\\*Application Deadline:\\*\\* November 15, 2024



We encourage you to submit your application as soon as you can as internship applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.



\\*\\*Internship Dates\\*\\* \\*\\*:\\*\\* June, 2025 – August, 2025 (You must be available to work during this period)



\\*\\*About Our Organization:\\*\\*



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation. Dow Jones works with many Global Fortune 500 companies providing the data, news and intelligence to help them reduce risk, ensure compliance and identify business opportunities. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



\\*\\*About the Team:\\*\\*



As part of the global Marketing organization, the B2B Enterprise Marketing team is responsible for driving business growth in partnership with the product and sales teams of our enterprise businesses: Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, and Risk & Compliance. The team runs a client centric approach focused on industries and accounts developing and activating strategies and campaigns that drive awareness, build our reputation and deepen relationships in these select industries and accounts.



\\*\\*About The Role:\\*\\*



We’re looking for an Organic Social Media Intern to assist with our social media activities. In this role, you’ll work closely with cross-functional marketing team members to bring campaign strategies to life for each of the business lines.



Reporting to the B2B Social Media Manager, you will support the global B2B marketing team in developing and executing organic social campaigns designed to deliver on key business objectives, including awareness, customer acquisition, engagement and customer retention.



You will develop skills and knowledge that are highly valued in the industry; gain practical experience in social media management and digital marketing. You will have the opportunity to work on real-world projects and contribute to the success of our marketing efforts. You will receive mentorship and guidance from experienced marketing professionals



This role is hybrid, based in-person in New York, NY.



\\*\\*You Will:\\*\\*



+ Assist the Social Media Manager with creating, curating, and scheduling engaging content across various social media platforms that drives engagement and community growth while raising awareness of Dow Jones brand and enterprise solutions.



+ Support the creation of visual content, including graphics and videos, using tools such as Canva.



+ Monitor social media channels for brand mentions, comments, and messages, and engage with the online community



+ Help analyze social media data to track performance and optimize strategies.



+ Conduct research on industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging social media tools and strategies



\\*\\*You Have:\\*\\*



+ Completed at least two years towards your Bachelor’s degree



+ Creative mindset, curious, continuously exploring better ways to engage customers through content



+ Someone who has a passion for understanding brand, customer and product as well as driving growth and utilizing martech



+ Results driven with ability to quantify performance and optimize results



+ Impeccable time management skills with the ability to multitask



+ Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing, Communications, Digital Media, or a related field



+ Strong interest in social media and digital marketing with a solid understanding of various social media platforms and trends



+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a keen eye for detail



+ Ability to work independently and as part of a team



+ An appreciation of visual communication, digital, social and content strategies



+ Bonus skills: Sprout Social (or similar), Canva



Salary: $25.00/hour

title: Paid Media Associate, WSJ
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\* \\*\\*About Our Organization:\\*\\*



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



About the Team:



The Wall Street Journal Paid Media team is looking for a Paid Media Search, Social & Display Associate to help drive acquisition growth across multiple paid media platforms. The ideal candidate will have 0-2 years of experience with managing Paid Search, Social and Display campaigns from start to finish. The paid media team is data driven, collaborative, and open to all ideas in order to help achieve growth goals.



\\*\\*About the Role:\\*\\*



The Paid Media Search, Social & Display Associate is a critical role and focuses on driving new subscribers for The Wall Street Journal by supporting the Paid Media team from strategic planning, execution, optimization, and analysis of digital marketing campaigns globally. You will gain experience building performance-driven campaigns on platforms including, but not limited to,Google, DV360, Bing, Meta, Twitter, TikTok, Snapchat etc.



This role is highly collaborative and will work across the organization with multiple stakeholders to identify opportunities for acquisition growth and to measure success. You will report to the Manager, Paid Media and work in our midtown Manhattan office three days each week.



\\*\\*You Will:\\*\\*



+ Create an effective strategic framework across paid search, social, display and programmatic media channels including Google (Google Ads and DV360), Bing, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Snapchat etc.



+ Be hands on in-platform – QA’ing campaign builds, optimizing keyword strategy, and monitoring performance.



+ Manage and optimize large media budgets across platforms and markets to maximize acquisition volume, increase audience reach and retain current members.



+ Actively report, track and optimize performance of media campaigns. Make recommendations and provide updates to the Acquisition and Creative Teams.



+ Work closely with platforms (Google, Bing, Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Snapchat, etc.) and vendors (e.g., agencies) to identify opportunities; understand their best practices and recommendations for improving paid search, social and display at Dow Jones.



+ Find ways to use media, creative and content to deepen our relationship with our audiences, to drive subscriptions, grow our digital channel footprint, and leverage all organic marketing efforts to reach users in meaningful and engaging ways.



+ Execute, manage, and optimize media campaigns and programs for WSJ both independently and in support of managers.



+ Handle daily campaign maintenance and optimizations including audience updates, budget pacing, and creative flips.



+ Run the campaign QA process to ensure accurate implementation and pacing.



+ Regularly report on campaign performance to cross-functional teams and answer internal questions regarding their status and performance.



+ Collaborate closely with internal acquisition, creative, brand, and operations teams to ensure campaigns are executed on time, meeting their deadlines.



+ Monitor campaign and media channel performance, ensuring that campaign goals are met and providing post-campaign reports.



+ Stay informed on industry trends, competitive landscapes and new technologies impacting digital marketing.



+ Demonstrate diligence, attention to detail and adherence to budgets.



+ Maintain and organize campaign-specific materials.



\\*\\*You Have:\\*\\*



+ The willingness to work on-site in our NYC office 3 days every week.



+ 0 – 2 years of digital media experience (this can include internships and co-ops), ideally with a focus on paid media.



+ Hands-on experience building and managing digital paid media campaigns on platforms including, but not limited to, Google, DV360, Bing, Meta, LinkedIn, and/or Snapchat.



+ An interest in emerging media channels and opportunities.



+ The desire to help drive innovation for global brands.



+ A pro-active, self-starter mindset and excellent communication skills, with experience seeking out and building the necessary relationships to achieve success.



\\*\\*Our Benefits\\*\\*



+ Comprehensive Healthcare Plans



+ Paid Time Off



+ Retirement Plans



+ Comprehensive Insurance Plans



+ Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources



+ Education Benefits



+ Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support



+ Commuter Transit Program



+ Subscription Discounts



+ Employee Referral Program

title: Associate Director, Paid Media, WSJ
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*



About Us:



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



About the Role:



We are looking to hire an Associate Director, Paid Media to lead the strategy, management, and optimization across Search, Social, Display/Programmatic and App campaigns for The Wall Street Journal (WSJ), which is the definitive source of news and information through the lens of business, finance, economics and money, global forces that shape the world and are key to understanding it.



As Associate Director, reporting to the Senior Director, Paid Media, you will manage a team of digital growth marketers, oversee all in-house paid media operations dedicated to acquiring WSJ subscribers, and work cross-functionally with teams across the marketing organization including, but not limited to, Acquisition, Engagement, Retention, Brand, and Audience.



You Will:



+ Work on-site in our midtown Manhattan office 3 days each week.



+ Manage a team of paid media managers and associates.



+ Oversee and drive the holistic strategic vision of in-house media campaigns across Meta, X, LinkedIn, Snapchat; Google, Bing; PMax, DV360; and App DSPs for WSJ.



+ Optimize media spend of ~$50M+ across platforms and markets to increase audience reach and maximize acquisition volume.



+ Develop, test, and share performance results with Acquisition and Creative teams to inform direction on creative offers, etc.



+ Implement measurement strategies to drive incrementality and improve efficiency.



+ Partner with Newsroom, Brand and Acquisition teams on marketing initiatives to develop a full-funnel media strategy across platforms.



+ Work with the Marketing Audience team on implementing new MarTech and advancing paid media reporting.



+ Present paid media strategy and performance to key stakeholders and SLT within the Performance Marketing team.



+ Support Senior Director, Paid Media in evaluating the overall value (costs, benefits, competitive analysis) of each tech platform, as well as proposed opportunities to execute and expand on the relationships.



You Have:



+ The willingness to work in our midtown Manhattan office 3 days each week



+ 10+ years of experience working in B2C digital media-based roles across paid search, paid social, display, programmatic, and other channels



+ Experience managing an annual budget of at least $30 million



+ Experience managing a team of direct reports and working with several cross-functional partners



+ Expertise media buying on Google, Bing, Meta, X, LinkedIn and Snapchat



+ In-depth experience with G-suite tech stack (GA4, DV360, CM360, SA360)



+ B2C subscription marketing experience is preferred



+ App acquisition experience is preferred



+ A bachelor’s degree in marketing or business administration is preferred

Dow Jones is looking for an organized individual for an Accounts Payable internship. You will report to the Senior Manager, Accounts Payable and have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the field of AP while working with a team of experienced professionals. You will assist with maintenance of the Master Vendor file in SAP to ensure that we remain compliant with IRS standards and payments are going out with correct banking details. You will also help with the day-to-day operations involved in Accounts Payable including validating invoices and processing invoice exceptions



This role is a hybrid, based in our Princeton office.



You Will:



+ Validate invoices for accuracy for SAP processing



+ Process and clear invoices out of SAP exception(s) for business action and/or posting



+ Update the Master Vendor File to compliance and accuracy



+ Collaborate with team members on management of shared email box and internal ticketing system



+ Assist employees with queries related to vendor and invoice status



You Have:



+ At least one year of school completed, working towards a bachelor’s degree



+ A GPA of 3.0 or higher



+ Previous relevant internship or part-time work experience



+ Analytical approach to solving problems



+ Excellent communication, organizational skills, and follow-up skills with strong attention to detail



+ Competency with the MS Office Suite, particularly Excel

We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic Learning & Development Summer Intern to join our Learning & Development team.



The Learning & Development Summer Intern will play a critical role in supporting the development and implementation of our company’s training programs. This internship provides an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the field of learning and development, while contributing to the growth and success of our organization.



This role is hybrid, based in our New York City office.

+ Assist in the design, development, and delivery of training programs, including creating training materials, conducting research, and coordinating logistics.



+ Collaborate with subject matter experts to identify learning needs and develop customized training content.



+ Develop and maintain training databases, track learner progress, and analyze training metrics to measure program effectiveness.



+ Support the creation and maintenance of our company’s learning management system (LMS), including uploading courses, managing user accounts, and ensuring system integrity.



+ Conduct research on emerging trends and best practices in learning and development, and make recommendations for incorporation into our training programs.



+ Assist in the planning and execution of in person instructor led sessions and corporate events.



You Have:



+ Completed at least two years towards your bachelor’s degree (liberal arts, education, writing, curriculum design, instructional design or related fields).



+ Communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.



+ Attention to detail with a commitment to accuracy and quality in data analysis and reporting.



+ Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines.



+ Passion for learning and development, with a desire to contribute to the growth and success of employees and the organization.



+ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills



+ Experience with Google suite of products.

This role is hybrid, based in our New York City office.

+ Learn the ins and outs of all things social (organic and paid), in addition to gaining a foundational understanding of branded content and digital advertising as they relate to social media

+ Coordinate and schedule the organic social calendar for Custom Content from WSJ



+ Manage asset creation requests for internal social posts, as needed



+ Assist in refreshing internal social resources, including decks, benchmarks, and imagery



+ Communicate cross-functionally to answer basic requests related to social media



+ Identify areas of opportunity by helping with cleaning and analyzing data for all social channels

+ Completed at least two years of a Bachelor’s degree



+ Familiarity with Facebook, Instagram, X (Twitter), and LinkedIn



+ Proficiency with Excel or Google Sheets



+ Passion for understanding consumer behavior and all sides of social media (paid, organic, and product)



+ Ability to multitask and manage your time



+ Natural curiosity for learning new processes and ideas

title: Manager, Paid Media, WSJ
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\* \\*\\*About Our Organization:\\*\\*



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



About the Team:



The Wall Street Journal Paid Media team is looking for a Paid Media Search, Social & Display Manager to help drive acquisition growth across multiple paid media platforms. The ideal candidate will have 6+ years of experience with managing paid search, social and display campaigns from start to finish. The paid media team is data driven, collaborative, and open to all ideas in order to help achieve growth goals.



\\*\\*About the Role:\\*\\*



The Paid Media Manager is a critical role and focuses on driving new subscribers for The Wall Street Journal and bundle products by supporting the Paid Media team from strategic planning, execution, optimization, and analysis of digital marketing campaigns globally. You will implement paid campaigns to drive subscriber growth across multiple social platforms including Google, DV360, Bing, Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Snapchat etc.



This role is highly collaborative and will work across the organization with multiple stakeholders to identify opportunities for acquisition growth and to measure success. You will report to the Associate Director, Paid Media and work in our midtown Manhattan office three days each week.



\\*\\*You Will:\\*\\*



+ Create an effective strategic framework across paid media channels including Google (Google Ads and DV360), Bing, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Snapchat etc.



+ Optimize US, International, and App strategies for each channel to improve performance and ensure the KPI goals are met.



+ Be hands on in-platform – QA’ing campaign builds, optimizing keyword strategy, and monitoring performance.



+ Manage and optimize large media budgets across social platforms and markets to maximize acquisition volume, increase audience reach and retain current members.



+ Find ways to use media, creative and content to deepen our relationship with our audiences, to drive subscriptions, grow our digital channel footprint, and leverage all organic marketing efforts to reach users in meaningful and engaging ways.



+ Actively report, track and optimize performance of paid media campaigns. Make recommendations and provide updates to the Marketing Team.



+ Partner with Data and Insights, Analytics, and Technology to gather data and establish new reports/dashboards.



+ Work closely with platforms (Google, Bing, Facebook/Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Snapchat, etc.) and vendors (e.g., agencies) to identify opportunities; understand their best practices and recommendations for improving paid search, social and display at Dow Jones.



\\*\\*You Have:\\*\\*



+ 7+ years’ experience in paid media.



+ Prove experience identifying meaningful, actionable insights within past successful social media campaigns.



+ Hands-on experience with developing and reporting on metrics and KPIs for business goals, process improvement projects, and campaign management.

Barron’s Wealth & Asset Management Group hosts a series of national, regional, and international invitation-only summits to recognize the achievements of the most successful and influential financial advisors in the wealth management industry. The summits are an excellent opportunity for elite financial advisors from across the industry to meet and discuss the latest innovations in the wealth services field, developments in the global economy, and strategies for personal and professional growth.



You will report to the Managing Director, Barron’s Wealth and Asset Management. You have an attitude of willingness to serve and ability to work with clients. You have skills tending toward quality control and accuracy.



This role is hybrid, based in our New York City office.



\\*\\*You Will:\\*\\*



+ Assist with research projects related to the wealth management industry



+ Support compiling invitation lists from Advisor Database for Advisor Summits



+ Update database of attendees to clean up duplicates and outdated information

+ Personal Outreach to summit invitees (via phone or email)



+ Help answer conference inquiries (website, email and phone) and filter to the correct department



+ Provide information and support to attendees as it relates to Advisor Summits, Regional events, and Advisor Rankings



+ Help with communications to conference speakers



+ Help maintain data for conference speakers and content submissions



+ Update the accuracy of conference content in internal databases, websites, and printed materials



+ Support and organize the Continuing Education Credit application process



+ Work in systems to manage projects, including FileMaker and Cvent

+ Completed at least two years towards your Bachelor’s Degree



+ Proficiency in Excel (can perform complex functions) or Google Sheets



+ Familiarity with financial data



+ A dynamic and engaging demeanor and the ability to gain expertise and earn trust with our clients



+ Organizational skills and attention to detail



+ The ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines



+ An interest in finance, computer science, business administration, wealth management

description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*



Summer 2025 Internship – Events



\\*\\*Application Deadline: November 15, 2024\\*\\*



We encourage you to submit your application as soon as you can as internship applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.



Internship Dates & Details: June 9, 2025 – August 15, 2025 (You must be available to work during this period)



About our Organization:



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



About the Role:



Be part of the team responsible for designing and producing first-class live events and experiences for Dow Jones, The Wall Street Journal and WSJ Barron’s Group. The Dow Jones Events team pivoted to virtual and hybrid events during the pandemic, and now produce virtual and in person events of all shapes, sizes and formats, bringing our brands to life for our members and our clients. At the heart of what we do is live journalism, connecting our audiences with newsmakers and big ideas, via ambitious experiences.



This position is a great opportunity for a talented and motivated person to join the team that produces best-in-class events and experiences for The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones and Barron’s Group. You will be responsible for working closely with the team to support all elements required to produce high quality member and client-focused events. You will gain insight into event production, design and management. You will work closely with colleagues in the US, EMEA and APAC regions.



This role is hybrid, based in our New York City office.



You Will:



+ Provide logistical support to the Dow Jones Events team to ensure effective and successful planning and delivery of events



+ Create and manage project plans



+ Handle venue research and site visits



+ Complete industry and competitive research



+ Conduct vendor research



+ Produce virtual breakout sessions for events



+ Be responsible for Inventory management



+ Take ownership of note taking



You Have:



+ Completed at least two years towards your Bachelor’s degree



+ Intermediate knowledge of Word, Google Sheets, PowerPoint, Gmail and Google Suite



+ Excellent written and verbal communications skills



+ Attention to detail



+ Understanding of Zoom



+ Basic level of graphic design is a plus



Salary: $25.00/hour

title: Art Director (NYC Hybrid)
description:
\\*\\*Overview\\*\\*



HarperCollins seeks an Art Director with a passion for sequential storytelling to join its graphic novel imprint, HarperAlley. Established in 2020, HarperAlley is a collaborative, creator-focused publisher of graphic novels across all age categories and genres. The ideal candidate will have 7–10+ years of experience art directing and designing graphic novels and possess strong written and oral communication skills. The highly motivated candidate will have a collaborative spirit and work across the division with a creative and dynamic group to publish groundbreaking books that will resonate with readers all around the world.



\\*\\*Responsibilities\\*\\*



+ Lead and refine process for cover and interior graphic novel development while designing and art directing a full list of books across all age categories and formats



+ Exhibit a passion for graphic novels with strong typographic vision on cover and interior design



+ Collaborate with and manage cartoonists, illustrators, letterers, colorists, flatters, and freelance designers to keep them on top of schedules to meet print dates



+ Be able to work independently and as part of the team while contributing to department goals



+ Be a team player with excellent time management skills, with ability to prioritize, multitask, manage resources across multiple projects, and meet deadlines



+ Manage budgets for assigned titles



+ Regularly check in with the Publisher and Creative Director



+ Occasional travel



\\*\\*Qualifications\\*\\*



+ 7-10+ years of progressive experience art directing and designing graphic novels {with a trade book publisher or Comics Publisher}



+ Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in the publishing industry



+ Experience managing illustrators, letterers, flatters and freelance designers, keeping track of schedules



+ Have an expert understanding of the needs of graphic novels from early development through printed book stages



+ Strong oral and written communication skills



+ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment



+ A positive, can-do attitude plus possesses the ability to work well with different types of personalities



+ Expert skills in Adobe Creative Suite, with experience in Clip Studio with proficiency in a Mac-based environment



+ Have an advanced understanding of offset printing and the print industry, as well as prepping files for the printer and reviewing proofs



HarperCollins Publishers is a company full of people who are passionate about books. When you apply for a position, we want to know why you want to work here, and why you are interested in the job. That’s why cover letters are \\*\\*strongly\\*\\* \\*\\*preferred\\*\\* .



HarperCollins Publishers is an equal opportunity employer.



The salary for this position is $100,000-$125,000. We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company. As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates. The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate’s experience, industry knowledge, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.



In addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including “elective” benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce.



\\_HarperCollins Publishers is an equal opportunity employer.\\_

title: Summer 2025 Internship – Developer Support Intern
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\*



Summer 2025 Internship – Developer Support Intern



Application Deadline: November 15, 2024



We encourage you to submit your application as soon as you can as internship applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.



Internship Dates: June 9, 2025 – August 15, 2025 (You must be available to work during this period)



About our Organization:



Our team has the privilege of delivering impactful experiences by helping our customers access the trusted news and business information published and produced by our marquee brands including, The Wall Street Journal, Barron’s, MarketWatch, Dow Jones Factiva, and Dow Jones Risk & Compliance. You will find that we are a collaborative group, focused on delivering excellence during every customer interaction.



About the Role:



As a Developer Support Intern at Dow Jones, you will assist customers in building applications that leverage our APIs and services. In this role, you’ll learn to represent Dow Jones by helping manage and resolve complex technical issues for developers integrating with our platform. This role offers a unique opportunity to work closely with experienced Developer Support Executives, learning essential skills for a career in technical and development support



You Will:



+ Serve as an advocate for developers using Dow Jones APIs, ensuring that our platform meets their needs.



+ Assist in maintaining the accuracy and clarity of our technical documentation to streamline developer integration.



+ Help in developing and testing the Dow Jones platform to enhance customer experiences.



+ Develop relevant sample code to support developers.



+ Contribute to managing and updating the Dow Jones Support site to improve accessibility and usability of resources for developers.



This role is hybrid, based in our Princeton office.



You Have:



+ Completed at least two years of school towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

title: Client Partner
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\* \\*\\*About Our Organization:\\*\\*



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



\\*\\*About the Role\\*\\*



The B2B Client Partner develops our client relationships within their industry sector with a view to delivering revenue targets by selling all Dow Jones products and services and increasing client satisfaction and retention across all brand and media solutions including custom content and conferences.



You will support the Client Director for their industry sector and will forecast sales activity and revenue achievement while creating referenceable customers.



\\*\\*You Will:\\*\\*



+ Develop and execute an effective relationship management plan for new and existing clients that positions us as the partner of choice for media solutions and drives revenue growth through face-to-face interactions.



+ Own the client – proactively seek and create opportunities to establish a strong client relationship which leads to exceedingly high levels of retention and satisfaction.



+ Maintain deep industry sector knowledge keeping abreast of industry trends and evangelize the value of Dow Jones products and solutions, proactively keeping clients abreast of new product offerings and product updates.



+ Qualify opportunities by quickly grasping a client’s complex business subject matter, focusing on the key aspects, defining the vision for delivering strategic and tangible business value using Dow Jones products and solutions.



+ Work collaboratively with industry sector and solutions teams to produce proposal presentations and documentation in a timely manner.



+ Close media sales opportunities in line with revenue targets.



\\*\\*You Have:\\*\\*

title: Associate Director, Paid Media, Barron’s & MarketWatch
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\* \\*\\*About Us:\\*\\*



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).



\\*\\*About the Role:\\*\\*



We are looking to hire an Associate Director, Paid Media to lead the strategy, management, and optimization across Search, Social, Display, and Programmatic campaigns for Barron’s and MarketWatch. Barron’s covers U.S. financial information, market developments, and relevant statistics, while MarketWatch provides financial information, business news, analysis, and stock market data.



As Associate Director, reporting to the Senior Director, Paid Media, you will manage a team of digital growth marketers, oversee all in-house paid media operations dedicated to acquiring Barron’s and MarketWatch subscribers, and work cross-functionally with teams across the marketing organization including, but not limited to, Acquisition, Engagement, Retention, Brand, and Audience.



You will report to the Senior Director, Paid Media and work cross-functionally with teams across the marketing organization including, but not limited to, Acquisition, Engagement, Retention, Brand, and Audience.



\\*\\*You Will:\\*\\*



+ Work on-site in our midtown Manhattan office 3 days each week.



+ Manage a team of paid media managers and associates.



+ Oversee and drive the holistic strategic vision of in-house media campaigns across Google, Bing, Meta, X, LinkedIn, and Snapchat for Barron’s and MarketWatch.



+ Optimize media spend of ~$10M across platforms and markets to increase audience reach and maximize acquisition volume.



+ Develop, test, and share performance results with Acquisition and Creative teams to inform direction on creative offers, etc.



+ Implement measurement strategies to drive incrementality and improve efficiency.



+ Partner with Newsroom, Brand, and Acquisition on marketing initiatives to develop a full-funnel media strategy across platforms.



+ Work with the Marketing Audience team on implementing new MarTech and advancing Paid Media reporting.



+ Present Paid Media strategy and performance to key stakeholders and SLT within the Performance Marketing team.



+ Support Senior Director, Paid Media in evaluating the overall value (costs, benefits, competitive analysis) of each tech platform, as well as proposed opportunities to execute and expand on the relationships.



\\*\\*You Have:\\*\\*



+ The willingness to work in our midtown Manhattan office 3 days each week



+ 10+ years of experience working in B2C digital media-based roles across paid search, paid social, display, programmatic, and other channels



+ Experience managing an annual budget of at least $6 million to $9 million



+ Experience managing a team and working with several cross-functional partners



+ Expertise media buying on Google, Bing, Meta, X, LinkedIn and Snapchat



+ In-depth experience with G-suite tech stack (GA4, DV360, CM360, SA360)



+ B2C subscription marketing experience is preferred



+ App acquisition experience is preferred



+ A bachelor’s degree in marketing or business administration is preferred



\\*\\*\\_#LI-HYBRID\\_\\*\\*



\\*\\*Our Benefits:\\*\\*



+ Comprehensive Healthcare Plans



+ Paid Time Off



+ Retirement Plans



+ Comprehensive Insurance Plans



+ Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources



+ Education Benefits



+ Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support



+ Commuter Transit Program



+ Subscription Discounts



+ Employee Referral Program

title: Medical Claims Analyst
description:
**Job Description: Medical Claims Analyst** 

Cahill Consultants, Inc. is a woman-owned and operated, full-service consulting firm that deploys customized and tailor-made services in the areas of regulatory compliance and analysis, process improvements and optimization, product recall, risk management, and professional training programs. At Cahill Consultants, Inc., we focus on developing long-term strategies that enhance our clients' preparedness and resilience in the presence of product safety challenges.

As a Medical Claims Analyst at Cahill Consultants, Inc. you will be responsible for evaluating, analyzing, and managing claims. This role involves investigating claims, reviewing documentation, reaching out to industry professionals, and ensuring compliance with company policies and industry regulations. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate effectively with both internal teams and external stakeholders.

**Responsibilities:**

* Evaluate and analyze medical bills and make determinations based on Cahill Consultants, Inc. criteria
* Investigate and gather necessary documentation for medical procedures
* Communicate with industry professionals and claimants, as necessary
* Monitor phones and emails
* Maintain accurate and detailed records of claims activity and decisions
* Prepare reports and summaries of claim status

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Insurance, Finance or other related field of study
* Previous Claims Analyst experience required
* Excellent communication skills
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
* Strong organizational and time-management skills required
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and manage sensitive information
* Proficiency in related software

**Working Conditions:**

* **Location:** Office environment – Located in East Setauket, New York
* **Hours:** [Full-time] regular working hours, typically 9am – 5pm
* **Travel:** Occasional travel may be required

If you thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, possess exceptional organizational skills, and are dedicated to delivering excellence, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Your contribution will be essential to our continued success. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome diversity and gender inclusivity.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Experience:

* ICD-10: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* East Setauket, NY 11733 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Service Technician
description:
**Commercial Refrigeration & Kitchen Technician - Will take Cold-Side ONLY Tech**

**Technician Pay:** $36-$43/hr

**Experience Required:** We are looking for a minimum of 5 years of technical experience with refrigeration, appliance repair, kitchen equipment, Commercial HVAC or relevant military service. EPA Universal (or EPA I & II) and/or CFESA certification preferred.

**Drug Test:** Yes -- controlled substances only

**Driving Record/MVR Check:** Yes

**Benefits:** Take home truck/van w/ gas card, Uniforms, Phone, Health, Life, Dental & Vision offered (Employees eligible on 1st of the month, after 60 days), 12 days PTO accrued after 30 days, 3 floating holidays, 48 hours for wellness/sickness.

**What’s in it For You:**

* On-the-job training with available on-demand technical support as well as ongoing formal hands-on and classroom training at our National Training Kitchen. Professional CFESA certifications with the potential for advancement.
* Receive a company service vehicle, fuel card, tablet and cell phone for business use
* Market-leading benefits program including 401k and paid time off
* Take charge of your career through growth opportunities including advanced technician and management positions

**What You Will Do:**

* Partner with restaurant and hospitality managers to offer comprehensive service solutions for commercial cooking, refrigeration, ware-washing, and other specialty food service equipment
* Demonstrate your mechanical aptitude, troubleshooting skills and ability to read diagrams and schematics
* Properly troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair Commercial Kitchen Equipment, including cooking, refrigeration, ware-washing and other specialty food service equipment
* Communicate with manufacturers as needed to help with diagnoses and parts identification
* Consult with the Technical Assistance Group for technical support while onsite
* Install all parts ordered for the customer in a timely and professional manner and in line with company policy
* Promote and recommend other services to customers when needed
* Produce accurate and timely administrative documents, such as work orders, time reporting, receipts, and truck stock inventory
* Follow safe work practices and accident prevention procedures
* Maintain a neat and orderly service vehicle, along with accurate parts and tool inventory
* Maintain productivity levels in accordance with company standards

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to frequently kneel, bend, squat, push, pull, reach, and occasionally lift and carry up to 70 pounds
* Ability to work with moving mechanical parts, pressurized steam equipment, open flames, heated surfaces, liquids, and risk of electrical shock in damp, humid, or freezing conditions
* Ability to work on ladders, roofs, and other high places

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or equivalent
* 5 years of technical experience with refrigeration, appliance repair, kitchen equipment, HVAC, or relevant military service
* Valid driver’s license and acceptable motor vehicle record
* Willingness and ability to be involved with the emergency on-call rotation that includes nights and weekends

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Relevant technical training, licenses, and/or certifications (i.e. EPA, CFESA)
* Commercial refrigeration and/or commercial cooking equipment repair experience
* Self-motivated with the proven ability prioritize and work independently with minimal direct supervision

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $36.00 - $43.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Company truck
* Dental insurance
* Fuel card
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Signing bonus

* Hot Side: 1 year (Preferred)
* Commercial HVAC/R: 5 years (Required)
